0.title: Doesn't hamper our equation: Sunny on dating rumours with Sharvari
0.article_body: Actor Sunny Kaushal said that the dating rumours with actress Sharvari Wagh "doesn't hamper" their equation. "We understand that...these are just news headlines. It would be stupid of us to make it a reality and take it very seriously," he added. Sunny called Sharvari a "very level-headed" person, who likes to "weigh out the pros and cons" in different situations.

1.title: Bournvita's Forced Packs aim to nudge society against forcing kids
1.article_body: Bournvita shared that as a society, we often force kids to follow particular career paths, overlooking their natural potential. At Bournvita, we wanted to open everyone's eyes, so we forced the iconic Bournvita jar to be something it wasn't meant to be, it stated, adding that if you too are against forcing kids, pledge with your Bournvita Forced Pack.

2.title: Nath cuts cake with Hanuman's pic on it; MP CM calls it an 'insult'
2.article_body: After pictures and videos surfaced of Congress leader Kamal Nath cutting a temple-shaped cake with Lord Hanuman's picture on it, Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that it's an "insult to Hindu religion and Sanatan tradition". "Society won't accept it," Chouhan added. Nath's supporters had prepared the cake to celebrate his birthday, which falls on November 18, in advance.

3.title: Old Pune-Mumbai highway reports more accidents than expressway
3.article_body: The old Pune-Mumbai highway under Maval and Vadgaon divisions recorded more accidents and fatalities than the expressway, as per data shared by the highway state police (HSP). While the expressway saw 36 accidents and 22 fatalities, the old highway reported 79 accidents and 53 deaths between January and October this year. In 2021 as well, the highway reported more deaths.

4.title: Bruce Willis going through really difficult times with aphasia: Sylvester Stallone
4.article_body: Actor Sylvester Stallone has shared an update on his friend Bruce Willis, saying he is going through "really, really difficult times" with aphasia. "He's been sort of incommunicado. That kills me, it's so sad," said Stallone. The Die Hard star's family announced in March 2022 that he was retiring after being diagnosed with aphasia, which affects language cognition.

5.title: Actress Muskan Bamne responds to troll who called her mother 'middle class'
5.article_body: 'Anupamaa' actress Muskan Bamne has responded to a troll who called her mother "middle class" after she posted a picture with her mother and grandmother. "Maa maa hoti hai...middle class ya upper class nahi," she wrote. "I love them and respect them very much...please don't do such comments," she responded to the troll who has now deleted their comment.

6.title: Temasek to write down entire $275-million investment in bankrupt FTX
6.article_body: Temasek Holdings said it would write down the value of its entire investment of $275 million in collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX. The Singaporean state investor joined the likes of SoftBank Group Corporation's Vision Fund and Sequoia Capital, who have also marked down their investment to zero after FTX Founder Sam Bankman-Fried filed for bankruptcy protection in the US last week.

7.title: BBMP issues warning to public to not share data with Chilume NGO
7.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) issued a statement asking public to not share voter identity details with the NGO under scrutiny, Chilume Educational Cultural and Rural Development Trust. The NGO was allegedly collecting personal information from public while conducting house-to-house surveys to help create awareness about voter helpline across several constituencies in Bengaluru.

8.title: 3 persons arrested for gambling in Hyderabad, ₹14,000 seized
8.article_body: The Chilkalguda police in Hyderabad arrested three gamblers on Wednesday and seized ₹14,830 cash, three mobile phones and other articles from them. "The three accused persons were betting at the time of raids," Station House Officer (SHO) G Naresh said. One of the accused persons, a labourer, used to organise gambling at a nearby auto stand.

9.title: Mumbai woman loses ₹1.12 lakh trying to get OTT app issue fixed
9.article_body: A 45-year-old Mumbai woman allegedly lost ₹1.12 lakh while trying to resolve an issue with her OTT application. Unable to stream content, the woman found a "customer care number" on the internet which turned out to be fraudulent. On the pretext of technical support, the suspect siphoned off money from her bank account through remote access to her phone.

10.title: I will continue to run Twitter until it is in a strong place: Musk
10.article_body: Testifying in a Delaware court in his $56 billion pay package case, Elon Musk remarked that he will reduce his time at Twitter and find a new leader to run the company. Responding to a Twitter user about this, Musk on Thursday also said, "I'll continue to run Twitter until it's in a strong place, which will take some time."

11.title: Karan Johar to launch Saif's son Ibrahim in his next project: Report
11.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar will reportedly launch Saif Ali Khan's son Ibrahim Ali Khan in his next production venture. The film, which is expected to go on floors in 2023, is reportedly based on defence forces and will be directed by Boman Irani's son Kayoze Irani. Recently, Ibrahim assisted Karan on his directorial venture 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'.

12.title: This news is toughest to digest: Amazon top exec to staff as layoffs begin
12.article_body: Addressing the employees as the company began layoffs, Amazon's Senior Vice President of Devices and Services Dave Limp shared a note. Limp wrote, "We continue to face an unusual and uncertain macroeconomic environment," and that this "news is tough to digest". He added that the affected employees will be helped with a separation payment, transitional benefits, and job placement support.

13.title: Amit Shah to inaugurate 1st phase of theme park on Shivaji in Pune
13.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah will inaugurate the first phase of a theme park based on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's life in Pune on November 20. Padma Vibhushan awardee late Balwant Moreshwar Purandare had formed the Maharaja Shivachhatrapati Pratishthan for the execution of this project. "This is the largest historical theme park in Asia," a trustee of the Pratishthan said.

14.title: Govt hikes windfall profit tax on crude oil, cuts diesel export rate
14.article_body: The government increased the windfall profit tax on domestically produced crude oil to ₹10,200/tonne from ₹9,500/tonne with effect from Thursday. The rate on diesel export was cut to ₹10.5/litre from ₹13/litre. The levy on diesel includes ₹1.50/litre road and infrastructure cess. The export tax on aviation turbine fuel, which was set at ₹5/litre on November 1, has not been changed.

15.title: 2 railway police officials caught with drugs worth ₹4 lakh in Thane
15.article_body: Two Kalyan Government Railway Police officials were arrested for allegedly possessing 921 grams of charas worth ₹4 lakh in Thane. The accused officials were allegedly going to sell the drugs to an unknown buyer. An officer of the anti-narcotics cell of Thane Police said they laid a trap by posing as buyers and caught the two on the spot.

16.title: Want to act again, I think I'll be able to do any role: Meenakshi
16.article_body: Actress Meenakshi Seshadri said that she wants to make her acting comeback. The actress added that because of the kind of roles she has done in the past, she thinks she will be able to do any sort of role. "It would be wrong on my part to limit myself to any particular type or category," she concluded.

17.title: No more waste dumping at Gurugram's Bandhwari landfill from Feb 1
17.article_body: Officials have said that no more waste will be dumped at the Bandhwari landfill in Gurugram from February 1 next year. The decision was made following a meeting of the committee formed by the National Green Tribunal to handle issues related to the landfill. Moreover, it was decided that the legacy waste will be processed in a time-bound manner.

18.title: What did Centre and RBI tell Supreme Court to defend demonetisation?
18.article_body: The Centre told Supreme Court that the 2016 demonetisation helped combat fake currency, terror financing, black money and tax evasion and encouraged sections of the informal economy to become part of the formal economy. The RBI said that public inconvenience cannot be a ground to challenge the validity of demonetisation when the decision was taken in the "national economic interest".

19.title: 11 ft Indian Rock Python rescued from Secunderabad railway quarters
19.article_body: Hyderabad-based NGO Friends of Snakes, which works for rescuing snakes, rescued an eleven and a half feet adult Indian Rock Python on Wednesday. The snake was rescued at the railway quarters in Secunderabad and it was assumed to be living in the habitat for over 20 years. The NGO is currently in process of relocating the snake to a forest.

20.title: CNG price hiked by ₹1 in Pune, climbs to ₹92 per kg
20.article_body: Maharashtra Natural Gas Limited (MNGL) has increased the price of compressed natural gas (CNG) for vehicles by ₹1 per kg in Pune city from Wednesday. The retail selling price of CNG now stands at ₹92 per kg. The new rate is also applicable in Pimpri-Chinchwad and adjoining areas of Chakan, Talegaon and Hinjewadi.

21.title: Amazon begins layoffs across company, expected to cut 10,000 jobs
21.article_body: Amazon on Wednesday confirmed that it has begun cutting jobs across the company. Spokesperson Kelly Nantel said, "Given the current macro-economic environment, some teams are making adjustments, which in some cases means certain roles are no longer necessary." While 10,000 job cuts are expected, the layoffs have affected the devices group and may include its retail division and human resources.

22.title: Republicans win control of US House of Representatives
22.article_body: Republicans have won 218 seats in US House of Representatives, the number needed for a majority. With the Senate staying in Democrats' hands, US congressional leadership will be divided for at least the next two years. Republican lawmakers have already said they want to roll back some of US President Joe Biden's programs, or defund many of them.

23.title: Punjabi singer Nachhatar Gill's wife passes away a day before son's wedding
23.article_body: Popular Punjabi singer Nachhatar Gill's wife Dalvinder Kaur passed away a day before their son's wedding. The daughter of the couple got married on November 14 while the marriage of their son was scheduled for November 17, which has been postponed for November 20th now. Dalvinder, who was diagnosed with cancer, was not keeping well.

24.title: Almost went bankrupt in 2004, started all over again: Anupam Kher
24.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher recalled he almost went bankrupt in the year 2004 as he wasn't a business-minded person. He added that he had to start all over again. "I'm a sum total of my failures. People started calling me thespian, veteran...which meant you should be given a lifetime achievement award...walk into the sunset...I refused to do that," he stated.

25.title: Telangana govt to build 104 link roads worth over ₹2,400 cr in Hyderabad
25.article_body: Under the Missing Links Projects (Phase-III), the Telangana government has planned to build 104 link roads worth ₹2,410 crore in Hyderabad to improve the city's infrastructure. While 72 roads will be built inside the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) boundaries for ₹1,160 crore, 32 additional roads will be built in the area's 10 Urban Local Bodies (ULBs) for ₹1,250 crore.

26.title: Dr Ambedkar's Mumbai home will be preserved as heritage: CM Shinde
26.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said that Dr B R Ambedkar's residence in Mumbai will be preserved as a heritage structure. "Ambedkar is the pride of the country, and the house where he lived is a historical treasure," he said. The ground-plus-three-storey house is located in central Mumbai's Dadar. It also houses a museum.

27.title: CM Bhupendra Patel files nomination for Gujarat polls from Ghatlodiya
27.article_body: Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel filed his nomination from the Ghatlodiya constituency in Ahmedabad for the upcoming state Assembly elections. The BJP leader filed his nomination in the presence of Home Minister Amit Shah. Earlier in the day, the two leaders held a roadshow in Ghatlodiya. While addressing the public, Shah termed Patel as the state's next Chief Minister.

28.title: Kuwait executes seven prisoners triggering global outcry
28.article_body: Kuwait on Wednesday executed seven prisoners, triggering international criticism over the mass execution. State media KUNA stated some of the executed persons were convicted of premeditated murder. The executed included one Kuwaiti woman, three Kuwaiti men, a Pakistani man, a Syrian man and an Ethiopian woman. Though the administration confirmed the executions, it didn't say which method was used.

29.title: Kamala Harris to visit Philippine islands near areas claimed by China
29.article_body: Vice President Kamala Harris will next week visit the Philippine islands of Palawan, which are on the edge of areas contested by China in the South China Sea, a senior US official said. The visit is set to take place on next Tuesday and it will make Harris the senior-most American official to visit the island chain.

30.title: India will launch talks over a new FTA next week: Piyush Goyal
30.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said India will start negotiations for a free trade agreement (FTA) with a region next week. He said that negotiations are going on with many regions, including the UK, EU, Canada and Israel. India could reportedly start talks with the Gulf Cooperation Council as the region was keen to increase economic engagement with India.

31.title: Mandavi Singh appointed 1st VC of Bhatkhande Sanskriti Vishwavidyalaya
31.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has appointed Professor Mandavi Singh as the first Vice-Chancellor of Bhatkhande Sanskriti Vishwavidyalaya (BSVV) in Lucknow. Singh is the former Vice-Chancellor of Chhattisgarh's Indira Kala Sangeet University. BSVV offers courses on music education in vocal music, rhythms, dance, musicology and applied music. It was upgraded into a state university in 2022.

32.title: At 11.1%, UK's inflation rate rose to 41-year high in this Oct
32.article_body: The UK's inflation rate rose to its 41-year high in October this year. Consumer prices increased by 11.1% in the 12 months before October. The inflation rate for the same period was 10.1% in September, according to the Office for National Statistics. The data was released a day before Treasury chief Jeremy Hunt is set to present a new budget.

33.title: Musk plans to reduce his time at Twitter, says he'll find a new leader
33.article_body: Twitter's new CEO Elon Musk on Wednesday said he expects to reduce his time at Twitter and eventually find a new leader to run the social media company. Musk added he plans to complete an organisational restructuring this week. "There's an initial burst of activity needed post-acquisition to reorganise the company," Musk said during his $56-billion Tesla pay package testimony.

34.title: Migrant worker from Bihar found dead in Srinagar, kin say he was shot
34.article_body: Balister Choudhary, a 35-year-old migrant worker from Bihar's West Champaran, was found dead under mysterious circumstances near Srinagar in J&K on Tuesday evening, his family said. "We have come to know he was shot on the chest. Srinagar Police sent the body for autopsy and began efforts to identify him by putting his photo on Twitter," Choudhary's brother Guddu said.

35.title: Lance Naik Manju becomes 1st woman soldier sky diver of Indian Army
35.article_body: Lance Naik Manju of Eastern Command has become the first woman soldier sky diver of Indian Army. She jumped on Tuesday from a height of 10,000 feet from ALH Dhruv helicopter. Sharing a video of the jump, Eastern Command tweeted, "This inspiring act...will set an example for other women in the Army." Manju is from the Corps of Military Police.

36.title: Russian economy contracts 4% YoY in third quarter
36.article_body: Russia's economy contracted 4% year-over-year in the third quarter of 2022, data from Russia's Federal State Statistics Service showed on Wednesday. During the second quarter, gross domestic product (GDP) fell by 4.1% year-over-year after international sanctions were imposed on the country. Russia's economy ministry sees GDP falling by 2.9% this year.

37.title: 26/11 attack survivor specially invited to Israel’s 25th Knesset
37.article_body: Moshe Holtzberg, who lost his parents in the 26/11 Mumbai terror attack, was specially invited to the inauguration of the newly elected Knesset (Israeli Parliament) on Tuesday. Sixteen-year-old Holtzberg recited Psalm 122 from the Book of Psalms at the inauguration. Holtzberg was two years old during the terror attack in Mumbai. His nanny had saved his life.

38.title: Was focused on reviving Tesla during crisis: Musk in $56 bn pay trial
38.article_body: Elon Musk said he was completely focused on Tesla in 2017 as the company was in "crisis", taking the stand in a Delaware court. Musk is facing allegations that his $56 billion pay package was based on easy performance targets and approved by a compliant board. Musk added that in 2016, he thought it was unlikely that Tesla would succeed.

39.title: Isaac Humphries becomes first Australian male basketball player to come out as gay
39.article_body: Isaac Humphries, who plays for Melbourne United in Australia's National Basketball League, has become the first Australian male basketball player to come out as gay. The 24-year-old shared a video of him breaking the news to his teammates. In the video, he also revealed that he attempted to take his life, adding, "I couldn't be who I am."

40.title: FTX's Bankman-Fried, celebrity promoters sued in US by crypto investors
40.article_body: FTX Founder Sam Bankman-Fried and several celebrities who promoted the exchange have been sued in the US over alleged deceptive practices to sell FTX yield-bearing digital currency accounts. The class action lawsuit alleged that crypto investors have sustained $11 billion in damages. The lawsuit seeks unspecified damages from Bankman-Fried and 11 athletes and celebrities who promoted FTX.

41.title: Kerala's Sabarimala temple opens, 30,000 devotees visit on eve of pilgrimage season
41.article_body: Sabarimala Sree Dharma Sastha Temple in Kerala's Sabarimala was opened on Wednesday evening on the eve of the annual Mandalam-Makaravilakku pilgrimage season. The season is expected to see a 40-50% rise in devotees in the absence of COVID-19 restrictions. Travancore Devaswom Board President K Anandagopan said 30,000 devotees turned up for darshan on Wednesday evening.

42.title: G20 countries pledge coordinated steps for global economic recovery
42.article_body: G20 countries, including the US, India and the EU, on Wednesday vowed to implement coordinated measures to ensure a resilient global economic recovery for delivery of jobs and growth. The group made the pledge in the G20 Bali Leaders' Declaration after conclusion of a two-day summit. The declaration said "we remain committed to support developing countries, particularly the least developed".

43.title: Efforts to counter terror financing must be stepped up: G20
43.article_body: The G20 on Wednesday said the global community must step up efforts to effectively counter money laundering and terror financing. In the G20 Bali Leaders' Declaration, the group reaffirmed its commitment to delivering the priorities of Paris-based FATF. "We welcome the initiative by the FATF to promote implementation of international standards on virtual assets," the declaration read.

44.title: Earthquake of 4.1 magnitude hits Himachal's Mandi; no casualties, damage reported
44.article_body: An earthquake of 4.1 magnitude on the Richter scale occurred 27 kilometres from Mandi in Himachal Pradesh at 9:32 pm on Wednesday. The depth of the earthquake was 5 kilometres below the ground, National Center for Seismology said. No casualties or reports of damage following the earthquake have yet been reported in Delhi and surrounding areas.

45.title: England cricketer Alex Hales reprimanded for old blackface photo from party
45.article_body: England opener Alex Hales, who was England's second-highest run-scorer in T20 World Cup 2022, has been reprimanded by the England and Wales Cricket Board's Cricket Discipline Commission for an old blackface picture of him from a party. Hales had apologised when the picture from 2009 surfaced online last year. No fine has been imposed on Hales.

46.title: Woman demands doctor's kidneys for allegedly removing hers fraudulently in Bihar
46.article_body: Sunita Devi, a 38-year-old woman whose kidneys were allegedly removed fraudulently at a hospital in Bihar, has demanded that she be given the organs of the doctor who operated on her. Sunita, who's on dialysis for survival, was at the hospital for hysterectomy surgery in September. The incident came to light when she complained of continuous stomach aches after surgery.

47.title: Will increase women's representation in Bihar police: Nitish Kumar
47.article_body: CM Nitish Kumar said on Wednesday that the Bihar government is planning to increase women's representation in the state police force to 35%. He said presently women makeup almost 28% of the state's police force. "The increased presence of women in the state's police force has not only empowered women but also made the constabulary more efficient," he said.

48.title: 145 gm gold worth ₹7.74 lakh seized at TN's Tiruchirappalli airport
48.article_body: Airport officials on Tuesday seized gold weighing around 145 grams worth ₹7.74 lakh from a passenger at Tiruchirappalli airport. The officials reportedly extracted the gold from paste-like materials concealed in the rectum of the female passenger. "The female passenger arrived at Tiruchirappalli airport from Kuala Lumpur by AirAsia flight...on November 15," a statement by officials said.

49.title: Turkish sex cult leader gets 8,658 years in jail for sexual assault, other crimes
49.article_body: An Istanbul court on Wednesday sentenced 66-year-old convicted Turkish sex cult leader and televangelist Adnan Oktar to 8,658 years in jail in a retrial. He was sentenced to prison on several charges including sexual abuse, and depriving someone of their liberty. Last year, he was sentenced to 1,075 years for crimes including sexual assault and sexual abuse of minors.

50.title: Money took the front seat over art: Aditya Narayan on quitting TV
50.article_body: Singer Aditya Narayan, speaking about quitting TV, has said that money took the front seat over art. "I've had my illustrious career with Indian television and hosting shows. I find it very difficult to say no to...money especially when it's in crores," he added. "I did television for a purpose and that purpose has been fulfilled," he stated.

51.title: Zomato clarifies it transfers 100% tips to the delivery partners
51.article_body: Zomato on Wednesday clarified that it transfers 100% of the tips it receives from the customers to its delivery partners. "We absorb all payment gateway charges, including administrative and convenience fees, to ensure tips remain 100% transferrable," the company said in its blog post. Zomato added that the tips are transferred as and when they are received.

52.title: 4 killed as mini-truck rams into lorry in Andhra Pradesh
52.article_body: A passenger mini-truck rammed into a lorry in Andhra Pradesh's Gandepalli village early on Wednesday morning, resulting in the death of four people. Out of the 13 people who were aboard the mini-truck, one died on the spot and three others died at the Rajahmundry Government Hospital. Two people sustained serious injuries and were undergoing medical treatment.

53.title: SBI signs €150 mn loan agreement with German KfW for solar project
53.article_body: State Bank of India (SBI) has signed a €150 million (about ₹1,240 crore) loan agreement with German development bank KfW to facilitate new and upcoming capacity in the solar sector. The bank said the long-term loan, under the Indo-German solar partnership, will facilitate upcoming capacities in the solar sector. The arrangement of the loan was facilitated by SBI Capital Markets.

54.title: Downey & I roasted Evans over 'Sexiest Man Alive' title: Hemsworth
54.article_body: Actor Chris Hemsworth revealed 'Avengers' co-star Robert Downey Jr and he roasted Chris Evans over his 'Sexiest Man Alive' title. "We have an 'Avengers' text chain...it...quickly was like, 'What are you doing with your hands back there?', Downey said he's being arrested, I said, 'beautiful mug shot'...Jeremy Renner said a series of things which I won't repeat," he stated.

55.title: FIR against BJP's Suvendu Adhikari over shoe comment on tribal MLA
55.article_body: West Bengal minister and TMC MLA Birbaha Hansda has filed an FIR under SC/ST Act against BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari for allegedly making "objectionable remarks" against her. This comes after a viral video purportedly showed Adhikari saying that Birbaha and MLA Debnath Hansda were "under his shoes". Birbaha claimed the remark was made as both she and Debnath are tribals.

56.title: Mobile industry agrees to phased rollout of USB-C port for all smartphones: Govt
56.article_body: The government held a meeting with electronic industry organisations, following which it said, "A broad consensus emerged among stakeholders on the adoption of USB Type – C as a charging port for devices like smartphones and tablets." Stakeholders agreed to a phased rollout of the common charging port. The feasibility of a uniform charging port for wearables will be examined.

57.title: FTX hacker 35th largest holder of Ether with $288 mn holding
57.article_body: The hacker who raided wallets of collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX has become the 35th largest holder of the Ether token after hauling almost $288 million worth of the coin. The wallet linked to the hacker swapped $49 million of stablecoins for Ether, according to security specialists PeckShield. It is suspected that $477 million in tokens was stolen from FTX wallets.

58.title: BJP will return to power in Himachal: CM Jairam Thakur
58.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur expressed confidence in the BJP's return to power in the state after the recently concluded polls. Calling the competition between BJP and Congress "tough", he said, "One thing is sure that big leaders of Congress are going to get defeated in this poll." Thakur added that female voter turnout increased in Himachal Pradesh.

59.title: Devastated, will remain available to police: Bumble after Shraddha Walkar's murder
59.article_body: Dating app Bumble on Wednesday said it was "devastated" to hear about the murder of Shraddha Walkar, allegedly by her live-in partner Aaftab Poonawala. "We will...remain available to law enforcement should they request our support. The safety and wellbeing of our members is our top priority," a spokesperson said. The accused and the victim had met on the dating platform.

60.title: Iran tried to kill 10 'enemies' who were living in UK: MI5 chief
60.article_body: Ken McCallum, Director General of the Security Service known as MI5, said that Iran's "aggressive intelligence services" have now crossed the line to threatening Britain directly. McCallum said, "[This] includes ambitions to kidnap or even kill British or UK-based individuals perceived as enemies of the regime." "We have seen at least 10 such potential threats since January alone," he added.

61.title: Cong announces final list for Gujarat polls, fields ex-CM Vaghela's son from Bayad
61.article_body: The Congress on Wednesday released its final list of 37 candidates for the Gujarat Assembly elections. The party has fielded former CM Shankersinh Vaghela's son Mahendrasinh Vaghela from the Bayad constituency. Mahendrasinh Vaghela quit the BJP and joined Congress recently. The state Assembly polls will be held in two phases on December 1 and 5.

62.title: Next state budget will be dedicated to the youth: Raj CM Gehlot
62.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said the next state budget will be dedicated to the youth and asked the students to send their suggestions. Addressing the students of Rajasthan University, he said the number of girls in colleges is more than that of boys, which shows that the state government is encouraging girl education in the state.

63.title: UP govt to build Ramayana, Mahabharata circuits under New Tourism Policy
63.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Cabinet on Wednesday gave approval to the New Tourism Policy under which the government is planning to build Ramayana, Mahabharata and Buddhist circuits. All the circuits will include places of religious significance belonging to the particular period. While Ramayana circuit will include places like Ayodhya, Chitrakoot etc, Mahabharata circuit will include Mathura, Vrindavan etc.

64.title: 8 die as SUV falls into gorge in J&K's Kishtwar
64.article_body: In Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district, eight people died after an SUV fell into a gorge on Wednesday evening, according to the police. The incident took place at around 5:30 pm and rescue operation is currently underway. Union Minister Jitendra Singh expressed condolences and said, "All possible assistance is being provided. Further help as needed would also be made available."

65.title: You've given BJP 27 years, try me once: Kejriwal to people of Guj
65.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday urged the people of Gujarat to give Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) five years in power. He said, "You've given BJP 27 years...Try me once...If you don't like my work, then send me away." Kejriwal reiterated his party's promises to build good schools, open 20,000 mohalla clinics and provide 10 lakh government jobs in Gujarat.

66.title: Arvind Kejriwal doing nothing to clean Yamuna: BJP
66.article_body: The BJP accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of not doing anything to clean the Yamuna river in the city, despite making election promises. BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said the Centre and the Delhi LG cleaned a 3-km stretch of the river in just three-and-a-half months. "Yamuna is polluted due to the inaction of his government," Delhi BJP President said.

67.title: AAP MLA Akhilesh Tripathi summoned by ACB in bribe for MCD poll tickets case
67.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Branch of Delhi has summoned AAP MLA Akhilesh Tripathi for questioning on Thursday after arrest of three men who allegedly took bribe on his behalf in exchange for party tickets in MCD polls. Tripathi's brother-in-law, personal assistant and another person have been arrested. They allegedly took money from a Delhi businessman to get his wife a councillor's ticket.

68.title: US man drinks 12 energy drinks in 10 minutes, develops acute pancreatitis
68.article_body: A US-based doctor, sharing a video on his YouTube channel, said that a 36-year-old man nearly died after he drank 12 energy drinks in 10 minutes. Dr Bernard Hsu said the man started experiencing heart flutters and developed acute pancreatitis, whereby his pancreas had begun 'digesting itself' due to the high levels of caffeine and sugar in the energy drinks.

69.title: Who are the top 5 Indians in latest rankings for T20I batters?
69.article_body: Suryakumar Yadav is the world number one T20I batter with 859 rating points, as per the latest rankings for T20I batters. Among Indians, he is followed by Virat Kohli, who is ranked 11th with 663 rating points. Kohli is followed by KL Rahul (17th), Rohit Sharma (18th) and Ishan Kishan (43rd).

70.title: PCB chief Ramiz Raja sends legal notice to Kamran Akmal over offensive remarks
70.article_body: PCB chief Ramiz Raja has sent a legal notice to Kamran Akmal for "defamatory, false and offensive" remarks. As per reports, Kamran had made the alleged remarks on his YouTube channel regarding Babar Azam-led Pakistan's performance in T20 World Cup 2022. "Ramiz has made it clear he isn't going to tolerate anyone running down...Pakistan cricket anymore," a source said.

71.title: Auditioned 2,000 girls to cast Munni in 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan': Kabir Khan
71.article_body: Filmmaker Kabir Khan revealed that they auditioned 2,000 girls for the role of Munni in his 2015 film 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan'. Kabir said he knew their biggest challenge would be finding the correct girl for the role of Munni. "If we didn't get the correct Munni, I don't think the film would be half what it is today," he added.

72.title: WB man kills girlfriend, confesses on social media before dying by suicide
72.article_body: A 28-year-old man allegedly killed his girlfriend and confessed to the crime in a video on social media before dying by suicide on railway tracks in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri on Tuesday. He killed his 30-year-old girlfriend by slitting her throat, police said. "I used to love her very much. I cannot live without her," the man said in the video.

73.title: Fired by Twitter after 3 weeks of chaos: Engineer who gave 12 yrs to company
73.article_body: Yao Yue, a Principal Software Engineer at Twitter, was fired from the company. She tweeted, "After 12 amazing years and 3 weeks of chaos...I'm officially fired by Twitter...Never expected I'd have stayed this long, and never expected I'd be this relieved to be gone." One of her colleagues tweeted, "Firing an engineer of Yao's caliber...means you're not a serious company."

74.title: Xi Jinping confronts Justin Trudeau over 'media leaks' at G20 summit, video viral
74.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau and Chinese President Xi Jinping had a confrontation at the sidelines of G20 Summit in Bali on Wednesday over an alleged "leak" of details of their informal talks to media. "Everything we said has been leaked to...papers, that's not appropriate," Xi told Trudeau. Trudeau responded by saying he believes in a "free, open and fair dialogue".

75.title: Dell to pay $1 bn settlement in lawsuit accusing it of short-changing investors
75.article_body: Dell Technologies has agreed to pay $1 billion to settle a lawsuit stemming from its December 2018 transaction involving its Class V stock. The lawsuit accused Dell of short-changing some investors in an approximately $24 billion transaction. The settlement also covers claims against Goldman Sachs, a defendant in the lawsuit, Dell said.

76.title: Govt receives ₹3,839 crore from sale of Axis Bank shares
76.article_body: DIPAM Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey said the government has received about ₹3,839 crore by selling a 1.5% stake in Axis Bank, which was held by Specified Undertaking of The Unit Trust of India (SUUTI). The floor price for the offer was ₹830.63 per equity share. With this sale, the government has now collected ₹28,383 crore in divestment proceeds this year.

77.title: Audience cares about who you date & less about films: Harsh Varrdhan
77.article_body: Actor Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor took to Twitter and praised Rajkummar Rao and Huma Qureshi's film 'Monica, O My Darling' and called it "brilliant". Along with the film's praise, Harsh tweeted, "It's become more about...what you eat...who you date than the body of work sadly...audiences are satiated by Bollywood blogs and care less about films in my opinion."

78.title: UK Paints acquires 50.092% stake in Berger Paints
78.article_body: UK Paints (India) has acquired a 50.092% stake in Berger Paints. UK Paints acquired the shares through an open-market transaction. The company has acquired the 20,000 shares that carried voting rights. Berger Paints India reported a consolidated net profit of ₹219.51 crore in the quarter ended September, up from ₹219.21 crore in the same period a year ago.

79.title: DLF, Naman Group, Adani submit bids for Dharavi redevelopment project
79.article_body: DLF, Naman Group and Adani Realty have individually submitted their bids for the redevelopment project in Dharavi, SVR Srinivas, MMRDA Commissioner said. "The next step is to scrutinise technical bids and open financial bids, thereafter," Srinivas added. The authority aims to complete the bidding process by the end of December 2022.

80.title: Novartis considers sale of ophthalmology, respiratory units: Reports
80.article_body: Swiss drugmaker Novartis is considering selling its ophthalmology and respiratory units, Bloomberg reported citing people familiar with the matter. The company is seeking to raise money from the possible sale of the assets to invest in cutting-edge medicines, the report said. Any sale of the ophthalmology and respiratory businesses is likely to begin in 2023, the report added.

81.title: India's exports to UAE rises 17.6% to $18 bn in April-October
81.article_body: India's exports to the UAE rose by 17.6% to around $18 billion during April-October this fiscal, Commerce Ministry's data showed. The free trade agreement between the countries was implemented on May 1. However, exports in October dropped by 18% to about $2 billion. Imports during April-October 2022-23 increased by 33% to $32.3 billion from the UAE, the data showed.

82.title: Demonetisation implemented after preparations, consultation with RBI: Centre
82.article_body: The Centre on Wednesday termed demonetisation as an effective measure and a larger strategy for combating menace of fake currency. In an affidavit filed in the Supreme Court, the Centre said demonetisation was a well-considered decision and was taken after extensive consultation with Reserve Bank of India (RBI). Advance preparations were made before imposition of note ban, the affidavit said.

83.title: Apple planning to use chips made in US & Europe from 2024: Reports
83.article_body: Apple is planning to buy chips made in US and Europe by 2024 in a bid to reduce dependency on Asia, Bloomberg reported citing CEO Tim Cook's comments. Apple has "already made a decision to be buying out of a plant in Arizona", Cook reportedly said. He added that Apple could expand its supply of chips from plants in Europe.

84.title: 29-year-old Bhavya Bishnoi takes oath as youngest MLA in present Haryana Assembly
84.article_body: Twenty-nine-year-old Bhavya Bishnoi on Wednesday took oath as the youngest MLA in the present Haryana Assembly. The BJP MLA won the November 3 bypoll from the Adampur constituency in Hisar district. Bhavya Bishnoi is the son of former senior Congress leader Kuldeep Bishnoi and the grandson of former CM Bhajan Lal.

85.title: Future will have Indian fingerprint everywhere, says UAE minister
85.article_body: UAE minister Omar bin Sultan Al Olama on Wednesday said, "The future is going to have an Indian fingerprint for everyone, everywhere." "If you want to see future of having a connected and enabled society...all you have to look is at India," Olama said. He added that future of technology, education, finance and other sectors will be reshaped by India.

86.title: SoftBank to sell $215 mn worth of shares in Paytm: Report
86.article_body: SoftBank is looking to sell $215 million worth of shares in Paytm ahead of the end of the lock-in period of pre-IPO investors in the fintech platform. SoftBank is looking to sell 29 million shares at a discounted rate of 7.72% to the current market price at ₹555 to ₹601.45 apiece. It had invested $1.6 billion in Paytm in total.

87.title: 69-yr-old tribal farmer killed in suspected tiger attack in T'gana
87.article_body: A 69-year-old tribal farmer, Sidam Bheem, was killed in a suspected tiger attack in Telangana's Kumuram Bheem Asifabad district on Tuesday. According to forest officials, Bheem was working in a cotton field when the animal attacked him and dragged his body towards the hills. However, the officials were unsure whether the farmer was attacked by a tiger or a leopard.

88.title: Missile attack likely caused by Ukraine but it wasn't intentional: Poland
88.article_body: Polish President Andrzej Duda said that the carnal damage by missiles that struck the country was "very likely" caused by the Ukrainian Air Defence. He, however, added that "there's no sign that it was an intentional attack on Poland". Notably, two people were killed after the missile fell on the territory of Poland in the Lubelskie province bordering Ukraine yesterday.

89.title: 32 former women IAF officers, who fought to serve for over 5 yrs, to get full pension: SC
89.article_body: Supreme Court ruled that 32 women, who have been fighting for the right to serve the IAF for more than their Short Service Commission tenure of five years, could be granted full pension. The bench, however, refused to order their reinstatement as they were released from service between 2006 and 2009. The court noted they had excellent track records.

90.title: People walked out during Salman Khan's 'Hum Aapke...' premiere: Barjatya
90.article_body: Filmmaker Sooraj Barjatya revealed that people began walking out during the premiere of Salman Khan and Madhuri Dixit's film 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun..!'. "I thought I had made the greatest film...when we had the premiere people were not liking it...the audience walking out with every song," he added. Barjatya stated that the film took off four days after its release.

91.title: AAP will sweep MCD polls, will implement 'Delhi model': AAP's Durgesh Pathak
91.article_body: AAP leader Durgesh Pathak on Wednesday said the party will sweep the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) polls and will implement the 'Delhi model' into it. "The MCD is in a bad condition and the situation has gone from bad to worse since 2017," Pathak said. He further claimed that the people of Delhi are irritated with the BJP.

92.title: 2 floors gutted in massive fire at Jamia Masjid near Kargil in Ladakh
92.article_body: A massive fire broke out in Jamia Masjid in Ladakh's Drass area near Kargil on Wednesday. There were no reports of any casualties in the incident. The top two floors of Jamia Masjid were completely damaged in the incident, an official said. The fire was brought under control with the help of the police, the Army and the local people.

93.title: 32 women IAF officers, who fought to serve for over 5 years, to get full pension: HC
93.article_body: Delhi High Court ruled that 32 women, who have been fighting for the right to serve the IAF for more than their Short Service Commission tenure of five years, could be granted full pension. The bench, however, refused to order their reinstatement as they were released from service between 2006 and 2009. The court noted they had excellent track records.

94.title: Central agencies quick to act against Opposition, but not BJP: WB CM
94.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday claimed that central agencies are quick to take action against Opposition leaders, but refrain from doing so when those from the BJP are involved in corruption. "Why is the BJP leader, whose flat deed was seized from the residence of one of the accused (in SSC scam case), not arrested?" Banerjee questioned.

95.title: Massive fire breaks out at Jamia Masjid in Ladakh; video surfaces
95.article_body: A massive fire broke out in the Jamia Masjid in Ladakh's Drass on Wednesday. In a video that surfaced on the internet, the fire appeared to have engulfed the entire compound and the building at the Jamia Masjid. According to reports, fire tenders were called from Kargil and other nearby areas to put out the fire.

96.title: Will-Chris slap incident will be mentioned in Oscars 2023: Host Kimmel
96.article_body: Oscars 2023 host Jimmy Kimmel said Will Smith and Chris Rock's slap incident will "come up" during the event in some way. Will slapped Chris after the latter cracked a joke on Will's wife Jada Smith during the Oscars 2022. "I don't want to...make light of it necessarily because it wasn't [light] to comedians...comedians are mad about it," he added.

97.title: It wasn't a surprise: Kane Williamson on being released by SRH
97.article_body: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson has said that it wasn't a surprise that SRH decided to release him ahead of IPL 2023. He revealed that SRH management had reached out to him a few days before making the announcement. "That's the way it goes, I had a really enjoyable time at SRH, I've a lot of fond memories," he added.

98.title: Obama hugged Manmohan Singh, called him his 'Gooroo' at a summit: Cong
98.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Tuesday said that at the 2009 Copenhagen Summit, then-US President Barack Obama embraced India's then-PM Manmohan Singh and asked him, "How is my Gooroo doing?" This comes after BJP's Amit Malviya tweeted about PM Narendra Modi at the ongoing G20 Summit and claimed, "When...Manmohan Singh returned from these summits...no one took note of India."

99.title: Italian man hit on mom Sridevi, dad Boney rushed from India: Janhvi
99.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor recalled an incident where a man hit on her mother and late actress Sridevi while she was shopping in Italy with her friend. "[Mom Sridevi] was shell-shocked...As a joke, her friend told dad (Boney Kapoor), who got so flustered, he left Khushi and me behind in Mumbai to fly to Italy to be with her," she added.

100.title: CPI(M) leader says Muhammad Ali was from Kerala, calls Messi 'mercy'
100.article_body: CPI(M) leader EP Jayarajan, in an interview about the upcoming FIFA World Cup in Qatar, referred to Argentinian footballer Lionel Messi as "mercy". During an interview in 2016, Jayarajan reportedly said Muhammad Ali was an eminent sports personality of Kerala and raised the state's stature in the world by winning a gold medal.

101.title: Filmmakers will face consequences if Pak artists seen in any film: MNS
101.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena's (MNS) cinema wing has warned filmmakers against hiring Pakistani artists. MNS said, "It has come to hear that...Bollywood filmmakers have started re-recruiting Pakistani artists." "[We're] giving clear hint that not only in Mumbai but anywhere in India for any drama/film if Pakistani talents will be seen then related makers will have to face consequences," it added.

102.title: PM Modi gifts paintings from Gujarat, Himachal to Biden & Rishi Sunak
102.article_body: PM Narendra Modi gifted US President Joe Biden a Kangra miniature painting from Himachal Pradesh as the G-20 Summit ended in Bali on Wednesday. PM Modi gifted the Gujarati handmade textile 'Mata Ni Pachedi' from Ahmedabad to British PM Rishi Sunak. Spanish PM Pedro Sanchez was presented with a Kanal brass set from Himachal Pradesh's Mandi and Kullu districts.

103.title: Aftab should be hanged publicly & our women should be cautious: Raut
103.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said Aftab Poonawala, who's accused of killing Shraddha and chopping her body into 35 pieces, should be hanged publicly and "our women should remain cautious". The police investigation has revealed that after killing Shraddha, Aftab transferred ₹54,000 from her bank account to his own and bought a 300-litre fridge.

104.title: 35-yr-old man attacked with acid over land dispute in Bihar, 2 held
104.article_body: A 35-year-old man was allegedly attacked with acid in Bihar's Supaul on Wednesday morning over a land dispute. The man sustained burn injuries to his back and leg. "We've arrested two persons including the main accused...and further probe is underway," Sub-divisional Police Officer (SDPO) Kumar Indra Prakash said, adding the police were examining the acid-like liquid.

105.title: NASA's Moon-bound Orion spacecraft captures view of Earth, pic surfaces
105.article_body: NASA's Moon-bound Artemis 1 Orion spacecraft captured view of Earth after being launched from Kennedy Space Center in US' Florida earlier today. Reacting to a footage shared by NASA, a user tweeted, "Unbelievably beautiful." "Absolutely breathtaking and humbling," wrote another. Artemis I is an uncrewed flight test of Space Launch System and the Orion spacecraft around the Moon.

106.title: Ukrainian air defence system likely caused blast in Poland, but it's Russia's fault: NATO
106.article_body: NATO's Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg said that Tuesday's blast in Poland that killed two was likely caused by a Ukrainian air defence missile. He added, "Let me be clear, this isn't Ukraine's fault...Russia bears responsibility for what happened in Poland yesterday, because it's a direct result of the ongoing war and a wave of attacks from Russia against Ukraine yesterday."

107.title: Pen-maker Rotomac Global booked by CBI in ₹750 crore bank fraud case
107.article_body: The CBI has booked Kanpur-based pen maker Rotomac Global and its directors for an alleged fraud of ₹750.54 crore in Indian Overseas Bank. Rotomac has a total outstanding of ₹2,919 crore against a consortium of seven banks led by Bank of India, in which Indian Overseas Bank has an exposure of 23%. The bank alleged manipulation in company's account books.

108.title: Jalan Kalrock moves NCLAT over Jet Airways payments: Report
108.article_body: The Jalan Kalrock consortium reportedly filed an application in the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) to seek control of Jet Airways. According to an order, the consortium has to pay additional payments of ₹250 crore as the unpaid provident fund and gratuity dues. Jalan Kalrock has reportedly already paid ₹150 crore of ₹475 crore approved in its Resolution Plan.

109.title: TMC MP Abu Taher Khan's car crushes 4-year-old boy to death in Bengal
109.article_body: A four-year-old boy was killed after being hit by the car of Trinamool Congress MP Abu Taher Khan in West Bengal's Murshidabad. The MP, who was on his way to Berhampore, took the child to a hospital, where he died during treatment. The accident took place while the boy was going to a nearby bank with his mother.

110.title: Williamson saves trophy from being blown away by wind during launch, video goes viral
110.article_body: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson saved the trophy from being blown away by the wind during its launch ahead of India-New Zealand T20I series. A video went viral showing Williamson catching the trophy and saying, "I will have that." Hardik Pandya, who will lead India in the series, was also seen holding the platform on which the trophy was kept.

111.title: Don't politicise: TN minister to BJP over 18-yr-old footballer's death
111.article_body: Tamil Nadu Minister for Medical and Family Welfare Ma Subramanian asked the BJP not to politicise the death of 18-year-old footballer R Priya. "The doctors were suspended following the report of...medical committee. We'll get...full report of the patient in a day or two," Subramanian said. Priya allegedly died following medical negligence by doctors at Government Peripheral Hospital in Chennai.

112.title: Startup park to come up near Bengaluru Airport: K'taka CM
112.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said a startup park will be developed near the Bengaluru Airport. Speaking at the Bengaluru Tech Summit, he said the plans for the park will be laid out within six months and it will cater to sectors from agritech to aeronautical technology. "With this, I think the tech summit will get a great fillip," Bommai said.

113.title: PM Modi, other G20 leaders plant mangroves in Bali; pics surface
113.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, US President Joe Biden and other G20 leaders planted mangroves in Bali's largest mangrove forest, Taman Hutan Raya Ngurah Rai, on Wednesday. PM Modi shared pictures from the forest on Twitter. PMO India said the visit to the forest by world leaders gave a strong message of coming together to tackle climate change and boost sustainable development.

114.title: Bitten by dog, K'taka boy dies after doctors fail to give rabies shot
114.article_body: A five-year-old boy, who was bitten by a dog in Karnataka, died after doctors failed to administer a rabies shot on time, police said on Wednesday. The deceased boy was bitten by a dog on October 30, following which he was taken to a hospital where the doctor administered an injection and sent him back.

115.title: SEBI to introduce cybersecurity framework to protect brokers
115.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) said it is planning to introduce a cybersecurity framework to protect stock brokers. The new framework is also looking to reduce impact of potential risks caused by cyber fraud, data leaks and hacking of trading accounts, according to an official. SEBI asked all cyberattacks to be reported within six hours of detection.

116.title: Tata plans expansion in beauty sector, to open beauty tech outlets
116.article_body: The Tata Group is planning to open 20 beauty tech stores and has listed The Honest Company, Ellis Brooklyn and Gallinee as potential partners, according to documents. The beauty tech stores will use virtual makeup kiosks and digital skin tests allowing customers to try on makeup virtually. With these stores, Tata will compete with Sephora and Nykaa.

117.title: Meta's former India Public Policy Head set to join Samsung: Report
117.article_body: Rajiv Aggarwal, the former Public Policy Head of Meta for India, is set to join Samsung Electronics' India unit, taking up similar responsibilities, reported Bloomberg. This comes a day after Meta announced that Aggarwal had stepped down from his post along with WhatsApp India head Abhijit Bose. Aggarwal will reportedly take up the position in December.

118.title: Road conditions in Maharashtra and Bihar equally bad: Jairam Ramesh
118.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh, who is walking in the Bharat Jodo Yatra, claimed that roads in Maharashtra are just as bad as in Bihar. "Maharashtra is number one in investment, but I have to say there is no difference in terms of roads between Maharashtra and Bihar," Ramesh added. The Yatra is on the 10th day of its Maharashtra leg.

119.title: Tamil Nadu govt announces free breakfast for students in Dindigul
119.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M K Stalin on Wednesday launched a free breakfast scheme for two schools and four colleges in Palani, Dindigul district. The cost of the scheme will be borne by Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments (HR&CE) Department. The state government launched this scheme in September, which is currently benefiting nearly 1 lakh students across 1,545 schools.

120.title: Tribunal awards ₹49.3 lakh compensation to Thane man for road accident injuries
120.article_body: Thane Motor Accident Claims Tribunal has awarded a ₹49.3 lakh compensation to a 29-year-old man for injuries he suffered in a road accident in 2017. Offending tempo's owner and its insurer have been directed to jointly and severally make the payment, along with 7% interest per annum. Failure to make the payment will result in interest rate rising to 8%.

121.title: Actress Suhasini stands as surety for Elgaar case accused Navlakha
121.article_body: Actress Suhasini Mulay appeared before a Mumbai court as surety for Elgaar Parishad case accused Gautam Navlakha. A surety takes responsibility that a person who is going to be released from prison would appear before a court whenever directed. Supreme Court has allowed Navlakha to be put under house arrest for a month after he said he had multiple ailments.

122.title: Australia to open Consulate in Bengaluru next year: Assistant Minister
122.article_body: Australia will start operating a Consulate in Bengaluru from next year, Australian Assistant Minister for Foreign Affairs Tim Watts said on Wednesday. In his address at the Bengaluru Tech Summit, Watts said his government is committed to strengthening its partnership in technology with India. Watts is leading a delegation of over 40 Australian technology companies at the summit.

123.title: Kerala man mistakes football team flags for SDPI's, destroys them; video surfaces
123.article_body: A video has surfaced showing a man destroying flags of Portugal's football team, put up on roadsides in Kerala's Kannur, after he allegedly mistook them for flags of Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI). The man mistook colours of flag of Portugal's team as those of SDPI's flag's. He later had an argument with team's fans, who questioned his actions.

124.title: List of most polluted Indian cities today released
124.article_body: The Central Pollution Control Board has released a list of most polluted Indian cities today. Bihar's Bettiah and Purnia are the most polluted cities with AQI of 423 & 418, respectively. They are followed by Begusarai (400), Siwan (394), Katihar (382), Darbhanga (378), Buxar (350), Muzaffarpur (347), Samastipur (344), Chhapra (341), Saharsa (334), Patna (311), Dharuhera (305) and Bhagalpur (304).

125.title: PM Modi broke tradition of not discussing domestic politics abroad: Cong
125.article_body: The Congress on Wednesday said Prime Minister Narendra Modi has broken the tradition of Indian Prime Ministers not discussing domestic politics with Indian audiences abroad. "This healthy convention was broken after May 2014, the latest example being in Indonesia where FekuMaster once again showed his self-obsession," tweeted Congress leader Jairam Ramesh.

126.title: Mumbai private schools violating RTE Act, BMC not taking action: AAP
126.article_body: AAP on Wednesday attacked Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) for its failure to take action against private schools violating the Right to Education Act. AAP leader Dhanraj Vanjari alleged the BMC education department was not taking any punitive action against such schools and giving them a free hand to act arbitrarily.

127.title: India no more a place known for red tape: PM Modi at tech summit
127.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said India is no more "a place known for red tape" but a place which gives "red carpet" to investors. In a pre-recorded virtual address for the Bengaluru Tech Summit on Wednesday, Modi said, "Technology has helped small businesses find a big customer. At the same time, this has reduced the scope for corruption."

128.title: List of most polluted Indian cities today released
128.article_body: The Central Pollution Control Board has released a list of most polluted Indian cities today. Bihar's Bettiah and Purnia are the most populated cities with AQI of 423 & 418, respectively. They are followed by Begusarai (400), Siwan (394), Katihar (382), Darbhanga (378), Buxar (350), Muzaffarpur (347), Samastipur (344), Chhapra (341), Saharsa (334), Patna (311), Dharuhera (305) and Bhagalpur (304).

129.title: Remove illegal hoardings or face action: PMC chief to civic officers
129.article_body: Pune Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar has asked civic officers to remove illegal hoardings in areas under their jurisdiction or else face departmental action. A PMC official said, "[Kumar] has warned of action against the officers...if they fail to remove illegal flexes across the city within a week. Such hoardings deface the city and the ward offices are ignoring the issue."

130.title: 55-yr-old biker dies after riding into pothole on Bengaluru road
130.article_body: A 55-year-old biker died in Bengaluru while trying to avoid a pothole, police said. The deceased man, identified as Kumar H, was a resident of Marappanapalya. Kumar drove into a pothole in Subramanyanagar when a tractor hit him. The accident on Monday has taken the number of deaths due to road accidents in Bengaluru since October 2021 to nine.

131.title: 23-yr-old Hyd man suffers burns after cracker misfires at TRS rally
131.article_body: A 23-year-old Hyderabad man who was hired to set off fireworks at bike rally organised by the Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) suffered critical burns. The TRS workers were celebrating the launch of eight new state government medical colleges. According to the police, one of the firecrackers misfired and triggered a fire and the man, identified as Kushal, suffered 40% burns.

132.title: Burger King parent appoints ex-Domino's CEO as executive chairman
132.article_body: Burger King parent company Restaurant Brands International (RBI) on Wednesday said it has appointed former Domino's Pizza CEO Patrick Doyle as executive chairman. As chair, Doyle won't earn a salary or a cash bonus, but will receive a one-time equity package of 2 million stock options that will vest in five years. Doyle was Domino's CEO from 2010 to 2018.

133.title: Ex-JD(S) leader, set to join BJP, found murdered in K'taka; private parts mutilated
133.article_body: Mallikarjun Muthyal, a former JD(S) leader who was set to join the BJP, was killed behind his electronic shop in Sedam town in Karnataka's Kalaburagi district. The 64-year-old was allegedly strangled to death and his private parts were mutilated, the police said. A day before he was murdered, Muthyal attended an event where Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai participated.

134.title: Jaguar Land Rover CEO to resign due to personal reasons: Tata Motors
134.article_body: Tata Motors announced that Jaguar Land Rover's CEO, Thierry Bollore, will resign due to personal reasons after more than two years in the role. He will step down effective December 31. Bollore had taken over in September 2020 from Ralf Speth. Adrian Mardell, a member of the company's executive board, will take over as interim CEO from Wednesday.

135.title: 12th pass acupuncture practitioner sexually harassed patients in B'luru; arrested
135.article_body: An acupuncture practitioner was arrested on Wednesday for sexually harassing female patients at his clinic in Bengaluru. The accused, identified as Venkatanarayana, would ask women and girls to take off their clothes and touched them inappropriately on pretext of treatment. He is a 12th pass who started his clinic after taking two-year training in acupuncture from a doctor, police said.

136.title: Night temperature in Hyderabad to drop as low as 12°C
136.article_body: Night temperature in Hyderabad will drop as low as 12° Celsius till November 18, according to the Telangana State Development Planning Society (TSDPS). The maximum temperature will be between 30-32° Celsius and the IMD said that the city will witness mist and haze in the mornings. Hyderabad witnessed the coldest October in a decade, with temperatures dropping to 14.9° Celsius.

137.title: Timings of 25 trains revised for Mumbai-Gandhinagar Vande Bharat train
137.article_body: Western Railway has revised the timings of 25 trains by few minutes due to the running of Mumbai-Gandhinagar Vande Bharat Express. Mumbai Central-Ahmedabad Shatabdi Express, Mumbai Central-Ahmedabad Gujarat Superfast Express and Bandra Terminus-Ramnagar Superfast Express are among the trains whose timings have been revised. Officer Sumit Thakur said the change aims to make train operations smooth.

138.title: Indian economy better placed among emerging Asian markets: Morgan Stanley
138.article_body: Indian economy is better positioned compared to other Asian emerging markets, Jonathan Garner, Chief Asia and Emerging Market equity strategist at Morgan Stanley, said in an interview with CNBC-TV18. "India is one of the most expensive markets and has enjoyed earnings growth in FY22, however, economies like Korea and Taiwan suffered blows due to semiconductor shortages,'' Garner added.

139.title: PM Modi gifts 'Mata Ni Pachedi' to UK PM Sunak, Kangra painting to US Prez
139.article_body: PM Narendra Modi gifted 'Mata Ni Pachedi' from Ahmedabad to UK PM Rishi Sunak and a Kangra miniature painting to US President Joe Biden at the G20 summit in Bali. He gifted Agate Bowls from Kutch to Singaporean PM Lee Hsien Loong, French President Emmanuel Macron and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz. He gifted a silver bowl to the Indonesian President.

140.title: Heavy rainfall, thunderstorm warning issued for several states, list released
140.article_body: The IMD has issued heavy rainfall and thunderstorm warning for several states/UTs for next few days. Heavy rainfall is very likely over Andaman & Nicobar Islands on Thursday. Thunderstorm accompanied with lightning is likely over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry on Friday and Saturday, and over Andhra Pradesh on Saturday. Heavy rainfall is likely over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry on Sunday.

141.title: UK PM Rishi Sunak tweets in Hindi as he shares pic with PM Modi
141.article_body: UK's Indian-origin PM Rishi Sunak on Wednesday took to Twitter to share his picture with PM Narendra Modi. "United by friendship," wrote Sunak, followed by a tweet in Hindi that read, "Ek mazboot dosti." The two leaders met for the first time at the G20 Summit in Bali after Sunak took over as the Prime Minister of the UK.

142.title: Auto driver returns lost AirPods to owner using UPI app in B'luru
142.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver connected his phone to a set of AirPods to track a woman who had lost the earphones while travelling in his vehicle. The woman, in her tweet, said that the driver connected the AirPods to find her name and used his PhonePe transactions to reach her. He later dropped the device off at her workplace.

143.title: Won't seize moveable assets of property tax defaulters: PCMC
143.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has put the decision of confiscating movable assets of property tax defaulters on hold. PCMC Assistant Municipal Commissioner Nilesh Deshmukh said, "We'd started the process last week…However, we have put the move on hold for now. It will be used as a last resort." "Whatever we do will be within the ambit of law," he added.

144.title: Got facial paralysis before major scene in 'Hum Aapke...': Anupam Kher
144.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher has revealed that he got facial paralysis before a major scene in Salman Khan-starrer 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun..!'. "The doctor had asked me to stay at home for two months...cancel the shooting," he added. However, Anupam stated he went to the sets and finished the shooting the same day. Anupam played Madhuri Dixit's father in the film.

145.title: TN BJP chief questions conditions of hospitals over footballer R Priya's death
145.article_body: Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai questioned the condition of hospitals after the death of an 18-year-old footballer, R Priya, following medical negligence at Government Peripheral Hospital in Chennai. "Does the hospital have all the facilities for surgery? What went wrong?" Annamalai questioned in an official statement. He also demanded ₹2 crore compensation to be provided to Priya's family.

146.title: Withdrew nomination voluntarily: Guj candidate who AAP said was ‘kidnapped’ by BJP
146.article_body: AAP's Surat (East) candidate Kanchan Jariwala said he withdrew his nomination from the elections voluntarily and without any pressure. In a statement, Jariwala said that he took the decision after people of his constituency labelled him "anti-national" and "anti-Gujarat" for contesting the election from AAP and threatened not to support him. AAP had accused BJP of kidnapping Jariwala on Wednesday.

147.title: My ex-husband gave me confidence: Kirti on her sex scenes in 'Four...'
147.article_body: Actress Kirti Kulhari, speaking about her sex scenes in the series 'Four More Shots Please!', said her ex-husband Saahil Sehgal gave her the confidence and support to do what she needs for her character. "He was not a guy who was insecure, who'd be like, 'No you can't kiss on-screen...have an intimate scene', which is...rampant in our industry," she added.

148.title: Aftab transferred ₹54,000 from Shraddha's account to buy fridge: Probe
148.article_body: Police investigation has revealed that after murdering his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar and chopping her body into 35 pieces, the accused Aftab Poonawalla transferred around ₹54,000 from Shraddha's bank account to his own. With the money, he reportedly bought a 300-litre fridge and kept the body parts in it. Notably, Delhi Police will conduct a narco analysis test on Aftab.

149.title: SC stays Bombay HC order against feeding stray dogs in public spaces
149.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday stayed certain observations of the Bombay High Court (Nagpur Bench), including the prohibition of feeding stray dogs in public spaces. The court also stayed Bombay HC's observation that those who feed street dogs must adopt them. The SC was hearing an appeal filed by three people, who were challenging the Bombay HC's observation.

150.title: Kerala HC stays cheating case against Sunny Leone
150.article_body: Kerala High Court has stayed a cheating case against Bollywood actress Sunny Leone. She had approached the court to quash the case over a complaint alleging she cheated organisers of an event in Kochi after receiving ₹30 lakh in advance. Sunny said she was ready to attend the function or return the money, but the organisers' indifferent attitude delayed it.

151.title: BJP uprooted appeasement politics, established rule of law in Guj: Shah
151.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday said the BJP ended "appeasement politics" in Gujarat and established the rule of law in the state during its 27-year rule. Speaking at an election rally in Ahmedabad, Shah alleged the Congress used to mock BJP over the construction of the Ram temple in Ayodhya and asked Rahul Gandhi to visit the temple.

152.title: Security guard killed in Pune, body found with head tied with cloths
152.article_body: A 55-year-old security guard was found murdered at the godown of a private company in Pune's Hadapsar area on Tuesday. Police officials said the head of the body was tied with cloths. Unknown assailants thrashed Kashanith Krishna Mahajan and killed him by tying his hands and feet with cloths, they added. Police suspect Mahajan died between Friday and Monday.

153.title: Actress Aindrila, hospitalised after brain stroke, suffers multiple cardiac arrests
153.article_body: Bengali actress Aindrila Sharma suffered from multiple cardiac arrests on Tuesday, as per the latest update. She was given CPR as per the authority of the Kolkata hospital where she is currently admitted. She is currently on ventilator support. Aindrila was hospitalised on November 1 after suffering a brain stroke. She suffered from an intracranial haemorrhage.

154.title: India's G20 Presidency will be inclusive, decisive, action-oriented: PM
154.article_body: As India on Wednesday received the G20 Presidency from Indonesia, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "I want to assure that India's G20 Presidency will be inclusive, ambitious, decisive and action-oriented." He said, "Together, we will make the G20 a catalyst for global change." India will work for collective action on challenges like geopolitical tensions and economic slowdown, he added.

155.title: Driver drives 8 km reverse as elephant chases bus in Kerala, video surfaces
155.article_body: A video showing a bus being chased by a wild elephant in Kerala has surfaced on social media. The driver of the private bus drove the vehicle in reverse gear for around eight kilometres until the elephant stopped the chase. "Everyone was gripped with fear... there was no way other than taking the bus in reverse," the bus driver said.

156.title: Veteran actor & Mahesh Babu's father Krishna cremated with full state honours
156.article_body: Veteran Tollywood actor and Mahesh Babu's father Krishna has been cremated with full state honours on Wednesday at Mahaprasthanam crematorium in Hyderabad. Krishna had suffered cardiac arrest and was shifted to the ICU for treatment and observation. The veteran actor had worked in 350 films and was honoured with the Padma Bhushan in 2009.

157.title: BJP criticises Cong leader over 'auction of girls' remark in Raj
157.article_body: BJP MLA Vasudev Devnani, on Wednesday, criticised Congress leader and Rajasthan Minister Ashok Chandna for allegedly making insensitive remarks on the issue of girls being 'auctioned' in the Bhilwara district. Devnani shared a video of Chandna where he was seen denying the reports of girls being sold for ₹10,000, saying even shoes are not available at that price.

158.title: Simplilearn raises $45 million in funding round led by GSV Ventures
158.article_body: US and India-based edtech platform Simplilearn has secured $45 million in a new funding round led by GSV Ventures at an undisclosed valuation. The funding round also saw participation from Clal Insurance and DisruptAD, among others. In July 2021, Blackstone acquired a majority stake in Simplilearn, which was founded by Krishna Kumar in 2010.

159.title: Police forcefully detained me over bike rally: Cong leader Sanjay Nirupam
159.article_body: Congress leader Sanjay Nirupam on Wednesday claimed that he was forcefully detained by the Versova Police for taking out a bike rally to put pressure on MP G Kirtikar to resign from his post for his inactivity in the constituency. "Instead of giving permission to carry out our peaceful political program, police forcefully detained me without showing...any order," he tweeted.

160.title: RSS & BJP should stop interfering in Sikh affairs: SGPC to Bhagwat
160.article_body: In a letter to RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee's (SGPC) General Secretary Gurcharan Singh Grewal said that the RSS and the BJP should stop their alleged "unnecessary interference" in Sikh affairs. He said, "BJP government...[is] interfering...to complicate SGPC affairs." He alleged that BJP leaders "on constitutional posts" directly interfered in the SGPC election.

161.title: Ex-Groupon CEO's firm Descript raises $50 million in Series C round
161.article_body: US-based audio and video editing platform, Descript, founded by former Groupon CEO Andrew Mason, has secured $50 million in a Series C funding round led by OpenAI Startup Fund. The funding round saw participation from Andreessen Horowitz, Redpoint Ventures, Spark Capital and ex-Y Combinator partner Daniel Gross. With this, the total amount raised by the startup increased to $100 million.

162.title: Masks no more compulsory during air travel: Govt
162.article_body: Government has issued revised COVID-19 guidelines for in-flight announcements regarding masks/face covers. "The in-flight announcements henceforth may only mention that in view of the threat posed by COVID-19, all passengers should preferably use masks/face covers," an order said. "Any specific reference to fine/penal action need not be announced as part of the in-flight announcements," it read.

163.title: AI services firm ﻿VuNet Systems﻿ raises $5 million in Series A round
163.article_body: Artificial intelligence services company ﻿VuNet Systems﻿ has raised $5 million in a Series A funding round. Mela Ventures and Athera Venture Partners (formerly Inventus India) led the funding round that also saw the participation of Dallas Venture Capital and TVS Capital Funds. VuNet Systems was co-founded by Ashwin Ramachandran, Bharat Joshi and Jithesh Kaveetil in 2014.

164.title: Healthcare firm BeatO raises $33 mn from Flipkart Ventures & others
164.article_body: Healthcare startup BeatO has secured $33 million in Series B funding round led by Lightrock India with participation from Flipkart Ventures, HealthQuad and other investors. Earlier, the startup raised multiple rounds of debt funding from Alteria Capital, Kotak Investment Advisors, among others. The company was founded by Gautam Chopra, Yash Sehgal and Kunal Kinalekar.

165.title: Hyderabad Police arrest chain snatcher, 60 grams gold seized
165.article_body: Hyderabad's Meerpet Police arrested a chain snatcher and seized gold ornaments weighing 60 grams from him. Police also seized a motorcycle and two mobile phones, all worth ₹3 lakh from the accused, Mohammad Amjad. Police began investigating after a woman filed a complaint stating two bike-borne men snatched her gold ornaments, injuring her on her hand, palm and neck.

166.title: UK inflation grows to 41-year high of 11.1% ahead of budget
166.article_body: The UK's rate of inflation hit a 41-year high of 11.1% in October on the back of rising energy and food prices, according to the Office for National Statistics. The new data comes a day before Finance Minister Jeremy Hunt will unveil a new budget. Hunt said that "tough but necessary" decisions were required to tackle rising prices.

167.title: PETA claims Assam elephant still in chains in TN, shares video
167.article_body: PETA India has claimed that Joymala, the elephant from Assam which is in the custody of a temple in Tamil Nadu, is still in chains. It also shared a video purportedly showing wounds on the elephant's legs. Furthermore, PETA India claimed that the video released by Tamil Nadu government in September, that alleged Joymala is doing good, is "not true".

168.title: What are you adding to it as director?: Pathak on frame to frame remake
168.article_body: 'Drishyam 2' director Abhishek Pathak opened up about the debate on Bollywood making remakes and said that "frame to frame" remakes need to be avoided. He added, "Don't do frame to frame, because then what are you adding to it as a director?" 'Drishyam 2' is also a remake of the 2021 Malayalam film with the same title.

169.title: Delhi court to pass order on Satyendar Jain’s bail plea tomorrow
169.article_body: A Delhi court will pronounce the order on the bail applications of Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain and two others in a money laundering case on Thursday. Jain had urged the court to grant him bail, saying that no purpose would be served by keeping him in custody any longer. The judge had reserved order after hearing arguments of accused persons.

170.title: Valuables worth ₹20 lakh stolen from locked house of Pune businessman
170.article_body: Gold ornaments worth ₹11.23 lakh and cash worth ₹9 lakh were stolen from the locked house of a 33-year-old businessman in Chikhali, Pune district. The incident reportedly took place between November 11 and November 13 when the occupants of the house were on a visit to religious places. They found a window of their house broken when they returned home.

171.title: Commit to 'hardcore' culture at Twitter or leave, Musk tells staff in email: Report
171.article_body: Elon Musk sent an email to Twitter employees saying that they must commit to a new "hardcore" culture at Twitter, as per a report. The staff was asked to click 'yes' on a link to pledge themselves to the "new Twitter" and if they failed to do so by Thursday, they'll be fired with three months of severance pay.

172.title: Listing of cases my priority, keeping close watch on it: CJI Chandrachud
172.article_body: CJI DY Chandrachud said he is "keeping a close watch on listing of cases" which is his priority in order to ensure that all fresh matters come up for hearing without delay. “I tell my registrar...Anything which is registered by Saturday, Monday, Tuesday, make sure it’s listed next Monday," he told a lawyer who sought urgent listing of a matter.

173.title: Snake pops out of SBI ATM machine in Maharashtra, video surfaces
173.article_body: A snake popped out of an SBI ATM machine in Maharashtra's Buldhana, following which it was rescued. A video of the incident, which shows a rescuer releasing the snake, went viral on the internet. According to reports, the incident came to light when three people went to the ATM to withdraw money.

174.title: 20,000 children under 5 yrs yet to be vaccinated for measles in Mumbai
