174.article_body: A survey conducted by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) revealed that 20,000 children under the age of five in Mumbai have not received the measles vaccination. "We've already organised 140 immunisation sessions in...public health facilities," Additional Municipal Commissioner Dr Sanjeev Kumar said, adding the immunisation gap was created in last two years. BMC began the survey in October.

175.title: Piramal Capital withdraws insolvency proceedings against Reliance Power
175.article_body: Piramal Capital and Housing Finance has withdrawn the insolvency proceedings against Reliance Power filed under section 7 of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code 2016, a BSE filing stated. The development comes after an out-of-court settlement between the companies over a ₹526 crore loan default by Reliance Power and its subsidiary Reliance Natural Resources Ltd (RNRL).

176.title: 3 injured in scuffle at Congress headquarters in Chennai; video surfaces
176.article_body: Three Congress party workers were injured after a scuffle reportedly broke out between two factions of the party at its headquarters in Chennai on Tuesday. The brawl allegedly took place over the appointments of party functionaries at the block level in the Tirunelveli district. A video of the incident showing police intervening to control the situation has also surfaced online.

177.title: Amazon's layoffs in India to be higher than other tech giants like Meta: Report
177.article_body: Amazon is likely to undertake a layoff exercise in India that could impact at least a few hundred jobs, The Economic Times reported citing people aware of the matter. "The layoffs might be relatively higher as compared to peers like Facebook-parent Meta and others," a person was quoted as saying. Amazon is reportedly laying off nearly 10,000 people worldwide.

178.title: This twist has stunned me: Suniel on Akshay's exit from Hera Pheri 3
178.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty said that the "twist" of Akshay Kumar's exit from 'Hera Pheri 3' has left him "stunned". "Everything was on track, but I don't know what happened...I want to see if things can still fall in place," he added. Previously, Akshay said he "backed out" of the film because he "wasn't satisfied" with its script.

179.title: No fuel source should be singled out for action: Environment Minister
179.article_body: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav at the UN climate summit in Egypt said no sector or fuel source should be singled out for action in fight against climate change. "In spirit of the Paris Agreement, countries will do what's suitable as per their national circumstances," he added. Developing countries should be provided their fair share of full carbon budget, he stated.

180.title: 7,500 acres of cannabis plantation destroyed in Andhra Pradesh: DGP
180.article_body: Andhra Pradesh DGP KV Rajendranath Reddy on Wednesday said that about 7,500 acres of cannabis plantation has been destroyed in the state since last year. "1,599 cases have been registered and 1,32,000 kg of cannabis has been seized so far in the state due to the efforts of the police," he said.

181.title: Over 6.85 crore IT returns filed for FY22 so far: Official
181.article_body: Over 6.85 crore income tax returns (ITRs) have been filed so far for fiscal 2021-22 and the number is expected to rise by December 31, as per a senior official. In the last fiscal, which ended on March 31, 2022, 7.14 crore tax returns were filed. So far this fiscal, refund worth around ₹2 lakh crore has been disbursed.

182.title: 21-yr-old B'luru model accuses Rapido biker of sexually harassing her
182.article_body: A 21-year-old Bengaluru model has accused a Rapido bike rider of sexually harassing her and touching her private parts, police said on Wednesday. The accused said his phone was switched off and asked the victim to guide him. When she started giving directions, the accused started touching her inappropriately, police said. The accused has been identified as Manjunath Tippeswamy.

183.title: Hyd company cheats thousands of people worth crores in investment scam
183.article_body: The Detective Department of Hyderabad Police stated that a company named 'MultyJet Trade Pvt Ltd' established an office in Hyderabad's Habsiguda and cheated unsuspecting investors. The company was established by Motilal Dulal, who was previously arrested in another multi-crore fraud. After coming out of jail, he established a scam investment phone-app and looted crores of money from people.

184.title: Bombay HC allows J&J to manufacture baby powder, orders fresh testing
184.article_body: Bombay High Court on Wednesday allowed Johnson and Johnson (J&J) to restart manufacturing of its baby talcum powder at their Mulund unit. The High Court directed Maharashtra Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to test fresh samples. However, the ban imposed by FDA on sale and distribution remains in force. On September 15, FDA cancelled J&J's baby talcum powder manufacturing licence.

185.title: Qualcomm's Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 SoC to feature on Android phones soon
185.article_body: Qualcomm announced that the new Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 system-on-a-chip (SoC) will be available on Android phones as early as year-end. The first Android phones featuring the new chip will come from ASUS, Honor, iQOO, Motorola, nubia, OnePlus, Oppo, Redmagic, Redmi, Sharp, Sony and Xiaomi, among others. The chip has 35% better CPU performance and 25% faster GPU performance.

186.title: BJP launches campaign song 'BJP ka matlab seva hai' for Delhi civic polls
186.article_body: BJP has launched its campaign song called 'BJP Ka Matlab Seva Hai' for the upcoming civic polls in Delhi. BJP MP Manoj Tiwari has sung and composed the song, which starts with the line "BJP ka matlab seva hai, sevak banaye rakhna (BJP means service, keep us as your servant)". Delhi Municipal Corporation elections will be held on December 4.

187.title: Mumbai-Mandwa water taxi fare cut to ₹250 & ₹350 for lower & upper deck
187.article_body: The Mumbai-Mandwa water taxi fare has been cut by ₹150 and ₹100. Accordingly, the fare for lower deck has been reduced to ₹250 from ₹400 and that of the upper deck was reduced to ₹350 from ₹450. According to the spokesperson of the shipping company, the fare was reduced to get more passengers and bring good competition in the business.

188.title: Polish missile strike shows West moving close to World War: Ex-Russian Prez
188.article_body: Former Russian President Dmitry Medvedev has said that an alleged missile strike on Polish territory showed that the West is moving closer to another World War. Earlier, Poland said that the country had no concrete evidence suggesting who fired the missile. Russia has said that it is not to be blamed for missile that landed at Poland-Ukraine border.

189.title: G20 statement includes PM Modi's 'Today's era must not be of war' remark to Putin
189.article_body: The G20 communique in Bali included Prime Minister Narendra Modi's message to Russian President Vladimir Putin, as it said, "Today's era must not be of war". In September, PM Modi told Putin that the "current era is not one of war". "India played a key role in the successful negotiations of the outcome document," Foreign Secretary Vinay Kwatra said.

190.title: Ricky Kej's album Divine Tides receives nomination at Grammys 2023
190.article_body: Music composer Ricky Kej's album 'Divine Tides' has been nominated under the Best Immersive Audio Album category at the Grammy Awards 2023. "I wasn't anticipating it," he said, adding that it's "pretty amazing" to be nominated alongside Christina Aguilera, The Chainsmokers and others. "It does feel quite amazing that an Indian album is competing with mainstream Western music," he added.

191.title: Ariana Grande's brother gets attacked & robbed in New York
191.article_body: Singer Ariana Grande's elder brother Frankie Grande was recently attacked and robbed by two teenagers, aged 13 and 17, in New York City. New York Police Department's spokesperson mentioned that while one attacker had an imitation pistol, another was in possession of a razor blade. Frankie, on his Instagram Story, addressed the incident and said he's "thankful to be safe".

192.title: 'Bigg Boss' smoking room sealed as contestants smoke openly, Sajid refuses to apologise
192.article_body: A new promo shows the smoking room in 'Bigg Boss 16' being sealed after contestants, including Sajid Khan, were seen smoking outside the room openly. The decision comes after multiple warnings to the housemates. Later in the promo, Sajid Khan can be heard saying "I am not going to apologise".

193.title: With respect to John Abraham, try giving him one of my dialogues: Anupam
193.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher, during an interview, said you can expect a "wonderful body" from an action hero like John Abraham and added, "With all due respect to him, try giving him one of my monologues." However, Anupam stated John will be able to do it. "You can expect great action from John...he can also act very well," Anupam further said.

194.title: Does PM have courage to apologise for BJP leader's shoe remark: TMC
194.article_body: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee on Tuesday asked if PM Narendra Modi has the courage to apologise for BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari's "derogatory" statement against Bengal Minister from the ST community, Birbaha Hansda. In a purported video shared by TMC leader Kunal Ghosh, Adhikari referred to Debnath and Birbaha Hansda as kids who remain under his shoes.

195.title: Death toll reaches 10 in Mizoram quarry collapse; ₹2 lakh ex-gratia announced
195.article_body: The death toll in the stone quarry collapse in Mizoram rose to 10 after two more bodies were recovered on Tuesday night. PM Narendra Modi has announced a ₹2 lakh ex-gratia for the families of each of the people who lost their lives in the incident. "My thoughts are with those who lost their loved ones," PM said.

196.title: Sensex closes at record high of 61,980; Nifty above 18,400
196.article_body: The Sensex on Wednesday rose 108 points to end at a record high of 61,980.72 while the Nifty ended at 18,409.65. While Apollo Tyres dropped 7%, Adani Green shares were up 4%. This marks the second straight day of all-time high closing for the Sensex index, which closed at 61,872 on Tuesday.

197.title: Man posing as masseur steals 'mangalsutra' from elderly woman in Pune
197.article_body: A 65-year-old woman allegedly lost her gold 'mangalsutra' worth ₹70,000 to an unidentified man who came to her house in Pune district on pretext of giving her body massage, police said. "The 'masseur' asked the woman to remove her 'mangalsutra' saying it would be a hindrance during massage. Later, the man fled the house with the ornament," the complaint stated.

198.title: Muktidham crematorium to switch to CNG fuel: Pune Cantonment Board
198.article_body: The Muktidham crematorium near Pune's Dhobi Ghat will be switching to environment-friendly CNG fuel soon, the Pune Cantonment Board (PCB) said on Tuesday. PCB CEO Subrat Pal said that the crematorium, which is currently non-fuctional, is expected to be relaunched by mid-Janurary 2023. Pal added that the Lions Club has raised ₹1 crore for the project.

199.title: BMC shuts part of Girgaon Chowpatty for Mumbai Coastal Road Project
199.article_body: BMC has cordoned off a portion of approximately 200 square metres at Girgaon Chowpatty for the Mumbai Coastal Road Project. Officials said this portion will be shut for the next seven months. Tunnels will be constructed under the surface of the beach. The project, expected to be completed next year, aims to link Nariman Point to the Bandra-Worli Sea Link.

200.title: Division of assets of $14 billion Hinduja Group to be done by November: Report
200.article_body: Division of the assets of the $14-billion Hinduja Group between family members could happen by November-end, according to a report. The development takes place six months after the family told a London judge that they had agreed to set aside a 2014 agreement. The matter could return to the court if a settlement isn't reached by the deadline.

201.title: It has been a tough week: Ex-WhatsApp India Head Abhijit Bose in post after resignation
201.article_body: WhatsApp India Head Abhijit Bose, who quit the company, shared a post on LinkedIn listing his team's achievements. Referring to the Meta layoffs and citing it as a reason for the delay in his resignation, he said, "It has been a tough week for all of our team." He added that he'll join the entrepreneurial world after a small break.

202.title: Sperm count declines accelerate worldwide, including India: Study
202.article_body: Sperm counts have fallen by more than half since the 1970s and the decline is accelerating worldwide, including in India, according to a study. The average sperm concentration fell from 101.2m per ml to 49.0m per ml between 1973 and 2018, a drop of 51.6%. Published in the journal Human Reproduction Update, the study used data from 53 countries.

203.title: Sweden to send its biggest military aid package to Ukraine worth $287 mn
203.article_body: Swedish Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson has said that Sweden will deliver its biggest defence package to Ukraine worth $287 million. Pal Jonson, Swedish Defence Minister, has said that the new aid package will include an air defence system and ammunition from stock piles of its armed forces. Previous military aid by Sweden included helmets, body armour, rocket-propelled grenades and missiles.

204.title: YEIDA extends deadline for Film City tender till January 31
204.article_body: The Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (YEIDA) extended the date for receiving applications to invest in the Film City project to January 31, 2023, from the earlier date of December 16, 2022. "We have extended the date as many potential investors wanted more time...Since the month of December falls in the holiday season, we accepted their request," YEIDA CEO said.

205.title: Speeding truck hits and kills 27-year-old police officer in Jammu
205.article_body: A 27-year-old police officer was killed after being hit by a speeding truck at Narwal bypass in Jammu on Wednesday, said police. Special Police Officer Rajat Choudhary was part of a police party checking vehicles near forest check post when the incident occurred. The truck driver was injured after he lost control of his vehicle and hit another parked truck.

206.title: Traffic advisory issued in Bengaluru due to road maintenance work
206.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police issued a traffic advisory on Wednesday regarding the diversion of vehicles from Old Madras Road to Indiranagar in East Bengaluru due to white topping work between 100 Feet Road junction and Lakshmipuram junction. According to the advisory, heavy vehicles from KR Puram are advised to use 80 Feet Road and Chinmaya Mission Hospital Road.

207.title: 30% recalibration of metres on taxis, autos in Mumbai completed: Union
207.article_body: Mumbai's autorickshaw and taxi drivers association claimed that recalibration of metres on around 30% of the vehicles has been completed. "We've already demanded the extension of the last date of metre calibration (November 30) fixed by...authorities," leader of Mumbai Taximen's Union said. The union plans to educate drivers about the importance of metre recalibration, rickshaw union leader said.

208.title: Sudanese national held for selling drugs in Hyd, 12 grams MDMA seized
208.article_body: The Hyderabad Narcotics Enforcement Wing (HNEW) along with Falaknuma Police on Tuesday arrested a Sudanese national and seized 12 grams of MDMA. The accused, 31-year-old Mohammed Yagoub Mohamed, is a resident of Bengaluru and was previously living in Hyderabad. Yagoub was allegedly carrying the drugs to deliver it to Mohammad Obaid Saleh Al Katheri, who was arrested earlier this month.

209.title: Analysis of DNA samples in Shraddha case will take 2 weeks: Forensic expert
209.article_body: According to a senior official from the Forensic Science Laboratory, Rohini, the process of DNA sampling in the Shraddha murder case is a challenging task, as the received samples are old. The process would take at least two weeks, the official said. Aftab, who's accused of chopping Shraddha's body into 35 pieces, stored her body parts in a fridge.

210.title: Govt planning to build 6 new cities across Karnataka: CM Bommai
210.article_body: Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai on Wednesday said that the Karnataka government is planning to build six new cities across the state to decentralise development. While one of these cities will come up near Bengaluru Airport, others will be built near Hubbali, Dharwad, Gulbarga, Mysuru and Mangalore. The cities will have the best innovation centres and top-class education institutions, Bommai said.

211.title: Disappointment is irrelevant: Tharoor on not being in Cong's Gujarat star list
211.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor’s name has not been included in the list of the party’s star campaigners for the upcoming Gujarat polls. Reacting to the development, Tharoor said, "I am sure the Congress party knows who or what might be effective in their campaigns. So, disappointment is irrelevant." The list has 40 names including that of party chief Mallikarjun Kharge.

212.title: She was a different person before she met Aaftab: Shraddha's father
212.article_body: The father of Shraddha Walkar, who was killed by her live-in partner Aaftab Poonawala in Delhi, said, "[Shraddha] was a different person before she met Poonawala." "She stopped talking to me and would rarely speak to her mother. I knew she was in...toxic relationship with that boy. I tried stopping her but she wouldn't listen," said her father Vikas Walkar.

213.title: FTX's Bahamas unit files for Chapter 15 bankruptcy in US
213.article_body: Crypto exchange FTX's Bahamas unit, FTX Digital Markets, has filed for Chapter 15 bankruptcy in New York to seek protection from creditors in the US. The filing allows a foreign debtor to shield assets in the country. This comes after parent company FTX filed for bankruptcy on Friday and its CEO Sam Bankman-Fried resigned on the same day.

214.title: 100-yr-old Mumbai eatery, once frequented by Rajesh Khanna, to be razed
214.article_body: The 100-year-old 'Sun Shine Restaurant, Bakery and Beer Bar' in Mumbai's Thakurdwar will shut down on Sunday as the building in which it's located will be demolished by BMC after November. The Iranian eatery was once frequented by superstar Rajesh Khanna and actor Pradip Patwardhan. A BMC official said the building is in a dilapidated condition and cannot be repaired.

215.title: Is it his money?: Siddaramaiah on BJP MP threatening to demolish Mysuru bus stand
215.article_body: After BJP MP Pratap Simha threatened to demolish a bus stand in Karnataka’s Mysuru which has dome-like structures on it, ex-CM Siddaramaiah said being an MP, Simha must not do such things. "Who is he to destroy the bus stop when it’s the government that spent money to build it? Is it his money?" Siddaramaiah asked.

216.title: Dog grabs boy's hand, bites him in Gr Noida society lift; video surfaces
216.article_body: A pet dog attacked a six-year-old boy inside a housing society's lift in Greater Noida. The boy was returning home from school, along with his mother, when the incident occurred. In a CCTV footage of the incident, which has surfaced online, the dog can be seen grabbing the boy's hand, while its owner was seen trying to drive it away.

217.title: Couple released on bail arrested again for drug peddling in B'luru
217.article_body: A couple, out on bail after being arrested for drug peddling in Bengaluru, was arrested by Bengaluru Police for the second time. The couple, tattoo artists by profession, was arrested with 12 kilograms of hashish oil worth ₹7 crore in March. They reportedly continued peddling drugs after bail. The drugs were brought from Andhra Pradesh, the police said.

218.title: Girl pushed to death from 4th floor in Lucknow; caste conversion case filed
218.article_body: A case under sections of murder and caste conversion has been filed after a girl was allegedly pushed to death from a building's fourth floor in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow, JCP (Law and Order) Piyush Mordia said. The incident occurred after the families of the girl and a man, Sufiyan, quarrelled over a gift given by him to her, Mordia added.

219.title: Reactors at 2 Ukrainian power plants shut down after Russian strikes
219.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said several reactors at two Ukrainian power plants have shut down due to Russian strikes, adding that millions of people were left without electricity. On Tuesday, Russian missile strikes led to death of one person and widespread power outage. Kyiv said it was the heaviest wave of missile strikes in nearly nine months of war.

220.title: Delhi Police to conduct narco analysis test on Aftab Poonawala
220.article_body: A Delhi court has accepted Delhi Police's request to conduct a narco analysis test on Aftab Poonawala, accused of killing his live-in partner Shraddha. Delhi Police is likely to write to the Bumble dating app to find out details about the women who visited him, reports said. Aftab, who chopped Shraddha's body into 35 pieces, met her on Bumble.

221.title: Crypto firm BlockFi preparing for layoffs, may file for bankruptcy: Report
221.article_body: Cryptocurrency firm BlockFi is expected to file for bankruptcy and is also preparing for possible layoffs, The Wall Street Journal reported. On Monday, BlockFi denied rumours of holding a majority of assets on Sam Bankman-Fried's FTX. However, it said it has significant exposure to FTX and associated entities. It also halted client withdrawals on November 11 after the FTX collapse.

222.title: Girl jumps out of moving autorickshaw to save herself from molestation in Maharashtra
222.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media where a minor girl can be seen jumping off a speeding autorickshaw in Maharashtra's Aurangabad. The auto driver allegedly tried to molest the girl and in an attempt to escape, she jumped from the moving vehicle on a busy road. The accused driver has been taken into custody.

223.title: Which brands are the world's top 10 plastic polluters according to a new report?
223.article_body: According to a report by Break Free From Plastic, The Coca-Cola Company, PepsiCo, Nestlé, Unilever and Mondelēz International are the world's top five plastic polluters. These are followed by Mars Inc, Procter & Gamble, tobacco company Philip Morris International, French food company Danone, and Ferrero Group. The Coca-Cola Company has been named the worst plastic polluter for five years running.

224.title: Will talk to Akshay & understand what happened: Suniel on 'Hera Pheri 3'
224.article_body: Suniel Shetty has shared his reaction to Akshay Kumar's exit from 'Hera Pheri 3' and the claims that Kartik Aaryan will star in the film. "I'll sit down...talk to Akki (Akshay) and others and see what happened," he said, adding that Kartik is not replacing Akshay. "The makers are in talks with Kartik for a completely different character," Suniel stated.

225.title: Latest rankings for T20I batters released after T20 World Cup 2022
225.article_body: ICC has released latest rankings for T20I batters following the conclusion of T20 World Cup 2022. England opener Alex Hales, who scored 86*(47) in the semi-final against India, climbed 22 places to be ranked 12th. India's Suryakumar Yadav retained his top position despite his rating points dropping to 859. South Africa batter Rilee Rossouw moved to the seventh position.

226.title: Elon Musk sent me an e-mail saying 'You're an a****le': US journalist
226.article_body: American journalist Kara Swisher, who's been covering Elon Musk since the late 1990s, revealed on a podcast that in the last interaction she had with Musk, he sent her an e-mail with the subject "You're an a****le". Musk also attached a screenshot of one of her tweets about him. Swisher told Musk that she had tweeted in favour of him.

227.title: Ajay Maken resigns as Congress party's in-charge for Rajasthan: Reports
227.article_body: Ajay Maken has resigned as the Congress party's in-charge for Rajasthan, reports stated. He reportedly wrote to party President Mallikarjun Kharge on November 8, expressing his unwillingness to continue. He's allegedly upset with the lack of action against MLAs who were served show-cause notice in September for skipping a meeting where Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot's replacement was to be picked.

228.title: Kathua rape and murder case accused Shubham to be tried as adult: SC
228.article_body: Supreme Court on Wednesday ruled that Shubham Sangra, one of the accused in rape and murder of an eight-year-old girl in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua in 2018, will be tried as an adult. A court in 2019 had sentenced three men to life imprisonment in the case and sentenced three police officers to five-year imprisonment for causing destruction of evidence.

229.title: ROHM Semiconductor, Suzuki Motor join Toshiba buyout proposal: Report
229.article_body: Japanese chipmaker ROHM Semiconductor said it was mulling joining the Japan Industrial Partners-led consortium to buy out Toshiba Corporation, The Nikkei newspaper reported. ROHM reportedly plans to invest up to about 300 billion yen ($2.14 billion) in the proposed 2.2-trillion yen acquisition of Toshiba. Suzuki Motor and Taisei Corporation also reportedly plan to invest in the proposed deal.

230.title: Woman killed after truck hits bicycle in Gurugram; husband injured
230.article_body: A woman was killed and her husband was critically injured after a truck ran over the bicycle on which the couple was travelling on Golf Course Extension Road in Gurugram. The couple's relatives and neighbours blocked the road for two hours in a protest and didn't let police remove the woman's body, officers said. The truck driver has been booked.

231.title: Couldn't play or go out, wondered why I worked in it: 'Drishyam' actress
231.article_body: 'Drishyam 2' actress Mrunal Jadhav said that after the release of the first instalment of the Ajay Devgn-starrer, she often regretted signing the film. "I couldn't go and play anywhere as people would mob me," she added. However, she shared that she had the realisation that 'Drishyam' was a "golden chance" and she felt grateful for the opportunity.

232.title: Australian regulator suspends licence of FTX unit until mid-May
232.article_body: Australian Securities & Investments Commission suspended the licence of the local arm of collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX until mid-May next year amid FTX's local units around the world facing heightened regulatory scrutiny. FTX Australia's permit to deal in derivative and foreign exchange contracts to retail and wholesale clients, along with providing general advice, has been taken back.

233.title: Pilot, Kanhaiya among Congress' 40 star campaigners for MCD polls
233.article_body: Congress has released a list of 40 star campaigners for the upcoming elections to the Municipal Corporation of Delhi. The list includes party's Delhi chief Anil Kumar Chaudhary and other leaders such as Ajay Maken, Sachin Pilot, Bhupinder Singh Hooda, Salman Khurshid, Pawan Khera, Alka Lamba and Kanhaiya Kumar. The elections are scheduled to be held on December 4.

234.title: Musk reveals he has lost over 13 kg, says 'Fasting + no tasty food' worked for him
234.article_body: Responding to a Twitter user who remarked that he had lost a lot of weight, the world’s richest person Elon Musk revealed he had lost almost 30 lbs or around 13.6 kg. When asked as to what made the most difference in his routine, Musk said it's a combination of fasting, diabetes medication Ozempic/Wegovy and "no tasty food" near him.

235.title: We don't need to prove anything: Pandya on Vaughan's 'most underperforming team' remark
235.article_body: Reacting to ex-England captain Michael Vaughan's remark that India are the most underperforming white-ball team, Hardik Pandya, who'll lead India in T20Is against New Zealand, said, "Being at the international level...I don't think we need to prove anything to anyone." He added, "It's a sport...you keep trying to get better and eventually when...result is supposed to happen it'll happen."

236.title: Cong’s Bharat Jodo Yatra continues in Maharashtra, heads for Akola
236.article_body: Congress party’s Bharat Jodo Yatra led by party leader Rahul Gandhi continued on the 10th day of its Maharashtra leg on Wednesday in Washim district. The yatra, which began at 6 am from Jambhrun Phata, will proceed to Medshi village in the evening and will take a night halt at Patur in Akola district.

237.title: 4 Sri Lankans involved in Rajiv Gandhi killing to be deported: Reports
237.article_body: Four Sri Lankan nationals involved in the assassination of India's former PM Rajiv Gandhi will reportedly be deported to their home country. The Ministry of Home Affairs has issued instructions to Tamil Nadu government in this regard, as per reports. The four - Murugan, Robert Payas, S Jayakumar and Santhan - are being kept in a special camp in Trichy.

238.title: Angry over delay, passengers stop local train in Thane
238.article_body: Angry over the suburban services running late, commuters stopped a local train at Titwala station in Thane for more than 20 minutes during the morning rush hour on Wednesday, officials said. A group of 10-15 commuters, including women, jumped on the tracks at around 8.30 am and stopped the local train which was heading from Kasara to CSMT, officials added.

239.title: Actress Denise Richards, husband shot at in US
239.article_body: A man opened fire at actress Denise Richards and her husband Aaron Phypers' truck in a road rage incident in US' Los Angeles on Monday. The duo stopped to look for parking when the driver behind them opened fire at their vehicle, TMZ said in a report. No one was injured in the incident.

240.title: AAP's Kanchan Jariwala takes back nomination after he was allegedly kidnapped in Gujarat
240.article_body: AAP candidate from Surat (East) for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections, Kanchan Jariwala, on Wednesday took back his nomination after he was allegedly kidnapped last evening, reported ANI. Earlier today, AAP leader Manish Sisodia claimed BJP abducted Jariwala, adding that Jariwala and his family were missing. Jariwala was seen walking out of the Returning Officer's office in Surat today.

241.title: There's something warm & nice about this photo: Paytm CEO on PM Modi-Sunak pic
241.article_body: Paytm Founder and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma on Tuesday shared a photo of UK PM Rishi Sunak meeting PM Narendra Modi. Sharma wrote, "There is something warm and nice about this photo." The two leaders met for the first time at the G20 Summit in Indonesia and the photo, which went viral, was initially posted on PM Modi's Twitter account.

242.title: US President Biden salutes PM Modi at G20 summit; pic goes viral
242.article_body: A picture showing US President Joe Biden saluting PM Narendra Modi during a visit to a mangrove forest in Bali on the sidelines of G20 summit has gone viral. The photo comes a day after Biden was seen walking over to PM Modi to greet him at the summit. The video also showed the two leaders exchanging a few words.

243.title: Tesla reports 2 new fatal crashes involving autopilot system: NHTSA
243.article_body: Tesla reported two new fatal crashes in Model 3 cars involving advanced driver assistance systems in the month ending October 15, the US' National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said. Tesla had previously reported 14 fatal crashes involving its Autopilot system since June 2021. The auto safety regulator has reviewed these crashes and is conducting appropriate follow-ups.

244.title: 5 Kashmiri journalists resign after terror threats on social media
244.article_body: Five journalists working in Kashmir resigned after terror threats were made against them on social media. A list of over a dozen journalists, including two editors of local newspapers, was put out allegedly by terrorists, who accused them of working for security agencies. According to police, The Resistance Front (TRF) is behind the threats.

245.title: 3 dead in blast at Andhra drug manufacturing unit; ₹20 lakh ex-gratia announced
245.article_body: At least three people were killed after an explosion took place at a drug manufacturing unit in Andhra Pradesh's East Godavari. A police official said that there was a technical problem with the pipeline and it exploded due to pressure caused by high temperature. The District Collector announced a ₹20 lakh ex-gratia for each of the deceased's families.

246.title: Akshay to play Jaswant Singh Gill, who rescued 65 coal miners in 1989
246.article_body: Akshay Kumar will essay the role of late engineer Sardar Jaswant Singh Gill in his upcoming film. Jaswant had saved 65 coal miners' lives in India's first coal mine rescue in 1989. Talking about the project, Akshay said, "It is my honour that I am playing Sardar Jaswant Singh Gill in my next film. It's a story like no other."

247.title: Stop being casual, reply by evening or pay ₹1 lakh fine: HC to Morbi civic body
247.article_body: Gujarat High Court on Wednesday told the Morbi civic body to stop being "casual" about the bridge collapse incident. The court also directed the district's civic body to give its response in the matter by this evening or "pay ₹1 lakh fine". This comes after the district's civic body failed to appear before the court at the bridge collapse hearing.

248.title: China-owned TikTok poses national security concerns: US FBI Director
248.article_body: The FBI Director Chris Wray has said the use of Chinese-owned app TikTok in the US raises national security concerns. Wray told US lawmakers the Chinese government could use TikTok to control data collection of millions of users, control the recommendation algorithm or control software on millions of devices. A TikTok spokesperson said reasonable national security concerns will be satisfied.

249.title: Will quit politics if link with Shraddha's killer proved: BJP leader
249.article_body: BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawala said he will quit politics if a link between Shraddha Walkar's killer Aftab Poonawala and him is proved. This comes after AAP MLA Naresh Balyan questioned if there was a connection between Aftab and the BJP leader. "There are many people by the surname of Poonawala," Shehzad said.

250.title: Jamaica declares state of emergency in some regions due to gang violence
250.article_body: Jamaican PM Andrew Holness declared a state of public emergency in parts of capital Kingston and other areas, to control crime linked to gang violence. Authorities have been permitted to search buildings and carry out arrests without warrants. Commissioner of Police Major General Antony Anderson said 71% of 1,360 murders registered in Jamaica from January-November happened due to gang violence.

251.title: Finland & China-based YAHAHA raises $40 mn from Alibaba & others
251.article_body: A Finland and China-based low-code gaming platform, YAHAHA, has secured $40 million in a Series A+ funding round led by Temasek and Alibaba. The funding round also saw participation from 37 Interactive Entertainment. In January 2022, YAHAHA raised a cumulative $50 million. The company was founded in 2020 by Chris Zhu, Pengfei Zhang and Hao Min.

252.title: Man blackmails student over intimate video with girlfriend in Mumbai, arrested
252.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested by the Anti Extortion Cell of the Mumbai Police Crime Branch for allegedly threatening and demanding money from a student on the pretext of circulating an intimate video of him and his girlfriend. The accused, Arbaaz Hanif Ukani, allegedly demanded ₹5 lakh from the 20-year-old student to delete the video.

253.title: Pakistani PM Shehbaz orders review of ban on Oscar entry film 'Joyland'
253.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has ordered a review of the ban on Pakistan's official 2023 Oscars entry 'Joyland', his adviser Salman Sufi said. As per him, a committee is being set up to "assess the complaints as well as merits" to decide Joyland's future in Pakistan. The order came days after 'Joyland' was banned because of "highly objectionable material".

254.title: Who are the 5 most expensive players released ahead of IPL 2023 auction?
254.article_body: Kane Williamson and Mayank Agarwal are the joint-most expensive players (₹14 crore each) who were released by SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) and Punjab Kings (PBKS), respectively, ahead of IPL 2023 auction. They are followed by Nicholas Pooran (SRH, ₹10.75 crore), Jason Holder (Lucknow Super Giants, ₹8.75 crore) and Romario Shepherd (SRH, ₹7.75 crore).

255.title: Shashi Tharoor reacts after woman trolled over her pics with him
255.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has reacted after a woman who had posted pictures with him was trolled. "It breaks my heart how people are using my pictures with Shashi Tharoor sir in the wrong context and spreading misinformation," she wrote. "Trolls should realise there are real human beings involved in their abuse...Keep your sick minds to yourselves, trolls!" Tharoor reacted.

256.title: Aftab visited Delhi clinic for cuts on hands, doctor says he was 'restless, aggressive'
256.article_body: Aftab Poonawala visited a clinic in Delhi's Mehrauli in May for treatment of "small wounds" on his hands that he said were sustained "while cutting fruits". "He was restless and fidgety, and a bit aggressive...He told me he works in the IT Sector in Gurgaon," Dr Anil Kumar said. Poonawala killed his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar on May 18.

257.title: NASA launches uncrewed Artemis 1 moon rocket after 2 failed attempts
257.article_body: After two failed attempts, NASA has launched its Artemis 1 moon rocket. The 32-story Space Launch System rocket surged off the launch pad from the Kennedy Space Center to send its Orion capsule on a three-week test journey around the moon and back without astronauts aboard. Previous launch attempts were aborted because of fuel line leaks and other technical problems.

258.title: Fired Twitter employee urges remaining staff to 'disobey' Musk, shares post
258.article_body: A Twitter engineer who was recently fired from the company urged the remaining employees to "disobey" Elon Musk. The UK-based engineer tweeted, “Tweeps that are still employed...If your personal situation allows...it is your moral duty to disobey...To protest. To quote tweet Elon when he lies on Twitter." Earlier, the ex-employee had tweeted that he got fired for "shitposting".

259.title: Gurugram woman injured in dog attack to get ₹2 lakh compensation
259.article_body: A woman, who works as a domestic help in Gurugram and was injured after being attacked by a pet dog in August, will get ₹2 lakh compensation as per the District Consumer Disputes Redressal Forum's order. This compensation amount can be recovered from the dog owner, the forum told Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG). The victim had suffered critical injuries.

260.title: BJP kidnapped AAP's Gujarat candidate Kanchan Jariwala, he & family missing: Sisodia
260.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Wednesday alleged that the BJP has kidnapped AAP's Surat (East) candidate Kanchan Jariwala due to the fear that he will defeat them in the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. He claimed that Jariwala and his family have been missing since yesterday. Jariwala was last seen at the office of the Election Commission, he also claimed.

261.title: India producing medical tools at 1/3rd world price: Union Minister
261.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh has said that even though India is among the top five countries in the world that are manufacturing life-saving high risk medical devices, the cost of our devices is one-third of those made by other four countries. Singh made the remark after inaugurating Combined Devices Block at Thiruvananthapuram's Chitra Tirunal Institute for Medical Sciences and Technology.

262.title: Real risk of recession in some major economies: WTO Chief
262.article_body: World Trade Organization (WTO) Director-General Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala warned that many major economies face a real risk of sliding into recession amid the war in Ukraine, rising food and fuel costs and soaring inflation. "It may not happen everywhere, but several key countries risk sliding into recession...impact of that can be quite significant for emerging markets and poor countries," she said.

263.title: Traffic restrictions announced in parts of Hyd for Formula E race trials
263.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police announced traffic restrictions and diversions from 10 pm on Wednesday to 10 pm on Sunday around NTR Marg for a street circuit race which is being conducted ahead of the Formula E race in February. The trial race will commence from IMAX (Necklace Road) Rotary proceed to Telugu Thalli on November 19 and November 20.

264.title: India reports 501 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 7,561
264.article_body: India reported 501 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 474 fresh COVID-19 cases. The number of active COVID-19 cases in India went down to 7,561 from the earlier 7,918. The death toll so far in the country stands at 5,30,535.

265.title: Man slits woman's throat in MP for being unfaithful, posts video with her body
265.article_body: A man allegedly slit a 25-year-old woman's throat in Madhya Pradesh and shared a video with her body on social media. The accused, identified as Abhijit Patidar, claimed he killed the woman for being "unfaithful" to him. The body of the woman was recovered from a room at a resort in Jabalpur on November 8. The prime accused is absconding.

266.title: Mind-blowing script & very quirky character: Neena on 'Lust Stories 2'
266.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta opened up about R Balki's short film in the upcoming anthology, titled 'Lust Stories 2'. She revealed that she plays "a very quirky character" of a grandmother, which "will surely surprise the audience". She added that the script of the short film was "mind-blowing". The R Balki directorial will reportedly star Mrunal Thakur in the lead role.

267.title: Nifty hits fresh 52-week high of 18,438 points, Sensex hits 62,000
267.article_body: The Nifty hit a fresh 52-week high of 18,438 points on Wednesday and the Sensex surged by 129.89 points to reach 62,002 points. Kotak Mahindra Bank, Eicher Motors, Dr Reddy's Laboratories, Tata Consultancy Services and Wipro are among the major Nifty gainers. Nearly 1,584 shares have advanced, 1,465 shares have declined and 128 shares remain unchanged.

268.title: Kapil Sharma shares pics of his physical transformation
268.article_body: Kapil Sharma took to Instagram to share pictures of his physical transformation and wrote, "If no gyming, then swimming." Reacting to the pictures shared by the comedian, actor Vindu Dara Singh wrote, "Looking super fit." Singer Zora Randhawa also commented on Kapil's post, writing, "I see that pump."

269.title: Every inch of NATO territory must be defended: Lithuania's President
269.article_body: Lithuania's President Gitanas Nauseda has said that "every inch of NATO territory" must be defended, after an explosion struck Poland near its border with Ukraine. "Keeping a close contact with our Polish friends. Lithuania stands in strong solidarity with Poland," Nauseda tweeted. "The terrorist regime will be stopped by united force of the allies," Nauseda said on Facebook.

270.title: Amazon begins mass layoffs at the company: Reports
270.article_body: Layoffs have begun at Amazon as it notified workers in several divisions, including Alexa and the Luna cloud gaming unit, as per reports. While one software engineer who worked on Alexa AI shared a post on LinkedIn about his termination, another engineer working on Amazon Luna said his team had been impacted. Amazon is reportedly expected to cut 10,000 jobs.

271.title: Parts of Hyderabad to face water supply disruption on Nov 17
271.article_body: Some parts of Hyderabad will face water supply disruption on Thursday, November 17, for 24 hours starting from 4 am. The areas to be affected include Uppal, Ramanthapur, Sri Sai RTC colony, Adarsh Nagar and Bhavani Nagar colony. The disruption will be due to the work that will be undertaken to address water pipeline leakage at LB Nagar and Mansoorabad.

272.title: Medanta operator Global Health's stock rises by 19% on market debut
272.article_body: Global Health, the operator of the Medanta chain of hospitals, which debuted on the stock exchanges on Wednesday rose by 19%, listing at ₹398.15/share on the BSE and ₹401/share on the NSE. Its IPO was subscribed 9.58 times during November 3-7 with retail investors bidding for 88% shares of the allotted quota and non-institutional investors buying 4.02 times the portion.

273.title: Missile that hit Poland fired by Ukraine at incoming Russian missile: Report
273.article_body: US officials on Wednesday said that initial findings suggest that the missile that hit Poland killing two people was fired by Ukrainian forces at an incoming Russian missile, the Associated Press reported. Earlier, Russia denied it was responsible for the explosion, however, Polish President Andrzej Duda told reporters that it was "most likely a Russian-made missile".

274.title: You are my hero: Krishna's daughter Manjula pens tribute for late actor
274.article_body: Late actor Krishna's daughter Manjula Ghattamaneni penned an emotional post as a tribute to her father, who passed away due to cardiac arrest. "You're my strength...my hero," she said, adding that he was "a loving, simple father" who made sure to be around for his children despite his busy schedules. She added that his discipline, generosity and wisdom are "unparalleled".

275.title: WhatsApp Pay biggest failure in India as a tech product: Ashneer Grover
275.article_body: BharatPe's ex-MD Ashneer Grover on Wednesday tweeted about how WhatsApp Pay has been the biggest failure in India as a tech product. "Everyone has WhatsApp on their phone—sending money on WA using UPI is as easy as sending pic. It should have beaten Paytm, PhonePe, GooglePay," he said. Notably, WhatsApp's India head Abhijit Bose quit the company on Tuesday.

276.title: PM Modi to inaugurate Bengaluru Tech Summit virtually today
276.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate the silver jubilee edition of the Bengaluru Tech Summit virtually on Wednesday, a statement from Chief Minister's Office (CMO) said. The three-day event is being held at the Bengaluru Palace grounds. The summit will witness not less than nine MoUs and the launch of over 20 products. The summit will have more than 575 exhibitors.

277.title: Work for Mula-Mutha river rejuvenation begins in Pune
277.article_body: The work for rejuvenation of Pune's Mula-Mutha river under a project initiated by Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) has begun. The work for three Sewage Treatment Plants (STP) has started. "Work on three more STPs will begin next week…PMC is setting up 11 STPs and a 55-km truck line to collect the sewage from various areas," said an official.

278.title: Delhi AAP MLA Akhilesh Pati Tripathi's relative arrested in cash-for-ticket case: ACB
278.article_body: AAP MLA Akhilesh Pati Tripathi's relative and two others have been arrested in a cash-for-ticket case, Anti Corruption Branch (ACB) officials said. An AAP worker's husband claimed that Tripathi demanded ₹90 lakh in exchange for a ticket for his wife for MCD elections and he'd paid ₹35 lakh to Tripathi and ₹20 lakh to AAP MLA Rajesh Gupta, officials added.

279.title: Hyd police receives hoax bomb threat call, searches conducted
279.article_body: Hyderabad Police received a bomb threat call on Tuesday following which the police immediately swung into action. Later, it was found to be a hoax call. A search operation was conducted at various localities, including temples and mosques in the IS Sadan Road area. Later, the police identified the person who made the call and he was taken into custody.

280.title: Poland considers invoking NATO's Article 4 after missile struck its territory
280.article_body: Poland is likely to request for consultations under NATO's Article 4 after an alleged Russian-made missile struck the country's territory near its border with Ukraine. Through Article 4, members can bring any issue of concern, especially security, for discussion. Polish President Andrzej Duda has said that all leaders he spoke with assured of allied support.

281.title: Who were the 5, 6 and 7 billionth children as the 8 billionth child is born?
281.article_body: Born on July 11, 1987, Matej Gaspar was the five billionth child, while Adnan Mevic, who was born on October 12, 1999, was the six billionth child. Sadia Sultana Oishee, born in 2011 became the seven billionth baby. The eight billionth child was born on Tuesday, the UN Development Programme said.

282.title: SP Jain Global announces new international campus in London
282.article_body: The SPJ Global Group has announced its international campus in London. Highlighting that the number of students interested to study in the UK has doubled in 2021, Founder & President Nitish Jain said, "London is a centre of global business and a great location for part-time jobs and internships". SPJ London will begin delivering undergraduate & postgraduate courses by mid-2023*.

283.title: 24-hour vehicle checking drive on Pune-Mumbai e-way from Dec 1
283.article_body: The Regional Transport Office (RTO) inspectors along with other government departments will begin a 24-hour vehicle checking drive on Pune-Mumbai expressway from December 1. RTO inspectors deployed in rotational shifts will check driving licence, pollution under control (PUC) certificate, renewal documents, national permit, registration certificate (RC) book of vehicle and other details.

284.title: 2 leopards walk into traps, get captured in Mumbai's Aarey
284.article_body: Two leopards were captured in Mumbai's Aarey on Tuesday after they walked into traps set by the forest department. According to officials, the animals, both female, have been sent to the Sanjay Gandhi National Park for medical examination. This comes days after a toddler was killed by a leopard in Aarey. Four leopards have been captured since then.

285.title: US-based firm Contentstack raises $80 million in Series C round
285.article_body: US-based content management platform, Contentstack, has secured $80 million in a Series C funding round co-led by Georgian and Insight Partners. The funding round also saw participation from Illuminate Ventures. After the latest investment, Contentstack has so far raised $169 million. The company was co-founded in 2018 by Matthew Baier, Neha Sampat and Nishant Patel.

286.title: Estee Lauder to buy fashion label Tom Ford in $2.8 billion deal
286.article_body: Luxury cosmetics firm Estee Lauder said it will buy designer fashion house Tom Ford in a deal worth $2.8 billion, its biggest deal ever. Estee Lauder already sells Tom Ford beauty products and fragrances and had introduced the line in 2006. The companies announced that Tom Ford will remain in his current position as creative director until 2023 at least.

287.title: 6 dairy farmers arrested in Pune for injecting cattle with oxytocin
287.article_body: Days after an operation of illegal production and sale of oxytocin was busted in Pune, the police arrested six dairy farmers for allegedly injecting cattle with the hormone to increase their milk-producing capacity. Notably, retail sale of oxytocin was banned in 2018. According to police officials, such drugs not only affect the animals but also people who consume their milk.

288.title: False: Musk on report claiming SpaceX is in talks to raise $1-bn fund
288.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said a Bloomberg report claiming that the rocket launch and satellite company is in talks to raise nearly $1 billion in a funding round that would value it at over $150 billion is false. Musk didn't elaborate further. The report said investors could buy new shares issued by SpaceX or from employees who opt to sell.

289.title: In a first, Railway passengers to get regional food on board
289.article_body: Railways has given IRCTC the flexibility to customise its menu by including regional cuisines and food suitable for diabetics, babies and health-conscious passengers. An official said passengers complained about lack of regional food, adding, "A train to Gujarat will have local delicacies like dhokla and vada pav for Maharashtra. This is the first time IRCTC is given such authority."

290.title: My father took his qualities with him, I'll explore mine: Irrfan's son Babil
290.article_body: Babil Khan, who's making his acting debut with 'Qala', was asked if he'd like to imbibe any of his father Irrfan Khan's qualities. In response, Babil said that his father took his qualities with him, and now, he'll explore his qualities and talents. Babil said he'll explore all kinds of films and will "improvise with what life throws" at him.

291.title: Musk to relaunch Twitter's blue tick subscription plan on Nov 29
291.article_body: Elon Musk has said that Twitter’s blue tick subscription service will be relaunched on November 29. He tweeted, "Punting relaunch of Blue Verified to November 29 to make sure that it's rock solid." Musk added that with the new release, changing one's verified name will cause a loss of checkmark until Twitter confirms the name to meet Terms of Service.

292.title: Delhi's air quality under 'moderate' category today with AQI at 176
292.article_body: The air quality in Delhi improved to 'moderate'  from 'poor' category on Wednesday with Air Quality Index (AQI) standing at 176. On Tuesday, the AQI in the national capital was at  227.  Meanwhile, the air quality in Noida remained under 'poor' category with AQI at 218, according to data shared by Noida Police at 8.40 am today.

293.title: Mumbai builder sells unauthorised flat, cheats man of ₹1.29 crore
293.article_body: A Mumbai-based builder allegedly sold an unauthorised flat in a Goregaon high-rise to a 77-year-old petrol pump owner. According to the complainant, the builder sold him a flat on the 15th floor of the building while he had permission for construction only up to the 14th floor. The victim claimed he has been cheated of around ₹1.29 crore.

294.title: Hindu Mahasabha pays tribute to Godse in MP; Congress seeks FIR
294.article_body: The Hindu Mahasabha on Tuesday paid tribute to Nathuram Godse, who had assassinated Mahatma Gandhi, on his death anniversary at its office in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior. Following this, Congress leader Arun Yadav shared a purported video of the incident and demanded that state CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan should identify these "anti-national" people and register an FIR against them.

295.title: UK announces 3,000 visas for young Indian professionals after PM Modi meets Sunak
295.article_body: The UK Prime Minister's Office on Wednesday tweeted, "Today the UK-India Young Professionals Scheme was confirmed, offering 3,000 places to 18-30-year-old degree-educated Indian nationals to come to the UK to live and work for up to two years." The announcement came after UK PM Rishi Sunak met PM Narendra Modi on the sidelines of the G20 summit.

296.title: Whoever does 'Bangalore Days' remake, all the best to them: Director
296.article_body: 'Bangalore Days' director Anjali Menon has reacted to reports that the upcoming film 'Yaariyan 2' is a remake of her 2014 release. "Whoever does it, all the best to them," she said, adding that she was approached by several studios to remake the film in Hindi but she refused. She further said that there's no scope for a sequel too.

297.title: RBI Guv to meet bank CEOs over sustainability, slow deposit growth
297.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das will hold a meeting with CEOs of public sector banks on Wednesday to discuss sustainability, including pricing and slow growth of deposits. The functioning of Digital Banking Units will also be reviewed. According to RBI data, deposits rose by 9.6% year-on-year as compared to 10.2%, while credit offtake surged by 17.9% as against 6.5%.

298.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra brought to fore 'real' Rahul Gandhi: Jairam Ramesh
298.article_body: Congress party’s Bharat Jodo Yatra has brought to the fore the “real" Rahul Gandhi and completely changed his image, Congress’ Jairam Ramesh said on Tuesday. "Before the Bharat Jodo Yatra, the BJP had created his certain image, especially on social media but it never portrayed the right Rahul Gandhi," he added.

299.title: Telugu film industry to remain shut on Nov 16, says producers council
299.article_body: Telugu Film Producers Council announced that the Telugu film industry will remain closed on Wednesday, November 16, as a mark of respect to the legendary late actor Krishna. The actor died in Hyderabad after suffering cardiac arrest. Celebrities such as Kamal Haasan, Rajinikanth and others mourned his death. Reportedly, Krishna will be cremated on November 16 with full state honours.

300.title: Managers of 2 Pune hotels booked for playing loud music
300.article_body: The managers of two hotel-cum-restaurants in Pune were booked for allegedly flouting noise pollution norms by playing loud music. The police seized a music system worth ₹2.85 lakh from 'Silver Spoon Restro and Lounge' in Kondhwa. They also seized a music system worth ₹2.34 lakh from 'The 3 Musketeers' in Viman Nagar for playing loud music at around 11.45 pm.

301.title: No pressure on Arhaan to carry our supposed legacy: Arbaaz Khan
301.article_body: Arbaaz Khan said that his son Arhaan Khan is under no pressure to carry forward the "supposed legacy" of his family in the film industry. He said he'll let Arhaan do anything that he's passionate about. Earlier, Arbaaz spoke about Arhaan's interest in filmmaking and shared that he had assisted Karan Johar. He'll also be assisting Arbaaz on 'Patna Shukla'.

302.title: 26 special trains to run between Secunderabad, Kollam for Sabarimala
302.article_body: The South Central Railway (SCR) will run 26 special trains between Secunderabad and Kollam till January, owing to the heavy rush due to the Sabarimala season. The special trains will consist of 2AC, 3AC, sleeper class and general second class coaches, the SCR's statement said. Thousands of devotees are expected to participate this year, officials said.

303.title: Consumer forum directs Gurugram civic body to ban 11 pet dog breeds
303.article_body: A consumer disputes redressal forum has issued a directive to Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) to ban 11 pet dog breeds with immediate effect. The forum did so while ordering the MCG to give an interim compensation of ₹2 lakh to a woman who was attacked by a dog in August. The banned breeds include Rottweiler, Bandog, Dogo Argentino, etc.

304.title: BBMP extends timings of public parks in Bengaluru amid public demand
304.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Tuesday extended timings of all parks across the city, following protests by citizens. According to BBMP's order, parks will now remain open from 5 am to 8 pm every day, except between 10 am to 1.30 pm due to maintenance work. Earlier, parks were open between 6 am-10 am and 4 pm-7 pm.

305.title: Mumbai woman accuses mother of cheating during online LLB exams
305.article_body: A 30-year-old woman, a doctor based in Mumbai, has filed a complaint against her mother for allegedly cheating during LLB exams that were conducted online during lockdown in 2020. She alleged that her mother asked a man to take the exams on her behalf while keeping the camera off. She also accused her mother of having extramarital affairs.

306.title: Musk shares pic with 2 men who faked being fired from Twitter after his takeover
306.article_body: Elon Musk tweeted a picture of him posing with men apparently named Rahul Ligma and Daniel Johnson and wrote, "Welcoming back Ligma & Johnson!" He added, "Important to admit when I'm wrong and firing them was truly one of my biggest mistakes." Ligma and Johnson had pretended to be laid-off Twitter employees giving media interviews after Musk's acquisition.

307.title: PCB evicts 500 hawkers from roads; 50 kiosks, 100 handcarts seized
307.article_body: Following criticism, Pune Cantonment Board (PCB) carried out a massive crackdown against unauthorised structures built by hawkers on roads and evicted 500 of them from MG road, East street and Centre street, among others. It also seized 50 kiosks and 100 handcarts. "We'll continue strong action against all unauthorised and illegal structures built by the hawkers," the PCB CEO said.

308.title: Poland blast may not be from Russian missile: US President Biden at emergency meet
308.article_body: The US and its NATO allies are investigating the blast that killed two in Poland, but early information suggests it may not have been caused by Russian missile, US President Joe Biden said. Global leaders gathered for the G20 meeting in Bali held an emergency meeting after explosions in Poland that Ukraine and Poland said were caused by Russian-made missiles.

309.title: Nominees for 2023 Grammy Awards announced, Beyoncé gets 9 nominations
309.article_body: The nominees for the 2023 Grammy Awards have been announced, with Beyoncé bagging most nominations (nine). She is followed by Kendrick Lamar (eight). Meanwhile, Adele and Brandi Carlile have bagged seven nominations each. The 2023 Grammy Awards will be the first time Beyoncé and Adele will go head-to-head for Record, Album, and Song of the Year since 2017.

310.title: Musk admits to firing staff critical of him, says 'I apologise for firing these geniuses'
310.article_body: Elon Musk admitted on Twitter that he fired employees who were critical of him on internal Slack channels. Replying to a tweet, Musk wrote, "I would like to apologise for firing these geniuses. Their immense talent will no doubt be of great use elsewhere." As per reports, Musk fired "dozens" of employees after they criticised him on Slack channels.

311.title: Donald Trump announces he will run for US president in 2024
311.article_body: Donald Trump has announced that he will run for the US president in 2024. "In order to make America great and glorious again, I tonight am announcing my candidacy for president of the United States," Trump said. "Two years ago, when I left office, the United States stood ready for its golden age," he further said.

312.title: Poland calls emergency meeting after 2 killed near Ukrainian border
312.article_body: Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki on Tuesday called an emergency meeting with national security and defence ministers amid reports of stray Russian missiles landing on the territory of the NATO country near Ukraine, killing two people. European Council President Charles Michel said, "Shocked by the news...I am in contact with Polish authorities, members of the European Council and other allies."

313.title: Russian missiles cross into NATO member Poland, 2 killed
313.article_body: Russian missiles crossed into NATO member Poland, killing two people, a senior US intelligence official said on Tuesday. As per reports, the weapons hit a grain store in Przewodów, Lublin, near the border with Ukraine. Earlier on Tuesday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy stated that Russia fired at least 85 missiles targeting Kyiv and other cities. "We'll survive everything," he stated.

314.title: Germany's gas storage levels hit 100% capacity earlier than expected
314.article_body: Germany's gas storage facilities have now reached 100% capacity, according to data published by the European gas storage association GIE on Tuesday. Berlin has been building its reserves since Russia significantly cut supplies amid tensions due to the war in Ukraine. Germany met its gas-saving targets ahead of schedule, having reached a 95% target set for November by mid-October.

315.title: Both Ukraine and Russia tortured prisoners of war: UN
315.article_body: Ukraine and Russia have tortured prisoners of war during the ongoing conflict between the nations, said the Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights on Tuesday. The UN's monitoring team based its finding on over 100 interviews it conducted with prisoners of war on each side. The forms of torture included electric shocks, assault and forced nudity.

316.title: Man accused of putting beef in temple granted bail by Allahabad HC
316.article_body: The Allahabad High Court granted bail to a man accused of putting beef inside a Shiva temple in Kannauj. The accused, Raheem, wasn't named in the FIR and his co-accused in the case had been granted bail by the high court in September. The case was lodged by a sub-inspector who was informed about the remains during a routine check.

317.title: Under-construction building collapses in Kenya's Nairobi
317.article_body: An under-construction, multi-storey building collapsed in the Kenyan capital Nairobi on Tuesday. Rescue operations started as construction workers are reportedly trapped under the debris. No official announcement has been made yet on possible casualties. The building was showing signs of weakness with visible cracks and local officials had asked labourers to leave, as per local media reports.

318.title: Pakistan PM Shehbaz tests positive for COVID-19 for third time
318.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Tuesday tested positive for coronavirus, a day after he returned to his country from the UK. This is the third time Shehbaz has tested positive for the disease. After announcing Shehbaz's positive diagnosis, Information Minister Marriyum Aurangzeb appealed to the people to pray for the Prime Minister.

319.title: Alphabet has too many employees, needs to cut costs: Hedge Fund TCI
319.article_body: Activist investor TCI Fund Management wrote to Alphabet, asking it to cut costs and take aggressive action like increasing share buybacks. The hedge fund added that the company has too many employees, and the cost per employee is too high. TCI, an Alphabet investor, also asked Alphabet to disclose its operating profit margin targets and reduce losses in Other Bets.

320.title: 45-year-old man, his 2 daughters found hanging at home in UP's Gorakhpur
320.article_body: A 45-year-old man and his two minor daughters were found hanging at his residence in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur on Tuesday. The man's wife had died due to cancer about two years ago and he used to run a tailor's shop from his house. "We've initiated a probe and statements of...family members are being recorded," Gorakhpur SSP Gaurav Grover said.

321.title: Thank you PM Modi for global traditional health centre: WHO chief
321.article_body: Director-General of the World Health Organization (WHO) Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus thanked Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday for collaborating with the world health body to build a global traditional health centre. The foundation stone for the WHO Global Centre for Traditional Medicine was laid in Gujarat's Jamnagar in April this year.

322.title: Shelling kills 2, injures 3 in Russia's Belgorod region: Guv
322.article_body: The governor of Russia's Belgorod region on Tuesday said that two people had been killed and three wounded by shelling in a town near the border with Ukraine. Belgorod is one of several Russian regions where targets such as fuel and ammunition depots have been hit in the course of the Ukraine war. Russia blames Ukraine for the strikes.

323.title: Punjab Police conduct cordon-and-search operation against drugs
323.article_body: The Punjab Police conducted a special cordon-and-search operation to check anti-social elements and drug smuggling in the state. The operation, which was conducted from 11 am to 4 pm, used sniffer dogs and drones in drug and crime hotspots to ensure strict vigil. "Proper frisking of suspects and complete search of houses was done," Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav said.

324.title: Speeding car hits over 12 labourers in MP's Ratlam; 4 killed, 8 injured
324.article_body: A speeding car ran over more than 12 labourers while they were working on a highway in Ratlam district of Madhya Pradesh on Tuesday, police said. While four labourers were killed, 13 others, including the car's five occupants, were injured. The injured were brought to the district hospital, said Ratlam Superintendent of Police Abhishek Tiwari.

325.title: Dharmendra Pradhan meets Finnish Education Minister in New Delhi
325.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan held a meeting with his Finnish counterpart, Petri Honkonen, in New Delhi on Tuesday. The ministers discussed topical issues of education in the challenging post-pandemic era, a press release by the Ministry of Education said. "The ministers also discussed...the path-breaking educational reforms currently underway in India," the communique added.

326.title: Hockey India announces 23-member men's team for tour of Australia
326.article_body: Hockey India has announced a 23-member men's team for the upcoming tour of Australia, beginning November 26 in Adelaide. Defender Harmanpreet Singh has been named the captain of the team, while Amit Rohidas has been picked as the vice-captain. The Indian team will play five matches against Australia as part of their preparation for next year's World Cup.

327.title: Oxygen cylinders weren't available in Delhi amid COVID-19: Kanhaiya
327.article_body: Congress leader Kanhaiya Kumar on Tuesday criticised the AAP and stated that oxygen cylinders were not available in Delhi during the second wave of COVID-19. Similarly, people were not getting oxygen cylinders in Ahmedabad civil hospital in BJP-ruled Gujarat, the ex-JNU student added. He further claimed that promises made during Anna Hazare's Andolan in 2011 were eventually shelved by AAP.

328.title: Completed 55% patchwork required to make Lucknow pothole free: Civic body
328.article_body: The Lucknow Municipal Corporation (LMC) has completed around 55% of the patchwork required to make the city pothole free, while restoration work on potholed roads stands at only about 15%, officials claimed. "The tender process for this is underway and will be finalised on November 22," Mahesh Verma, Chief Engineer said. "The work will begin from November 23," Verma added.

329.title: Continental probes reported data theft after cyberattack
329.article_body: Tyre and automotive parts manufacturer Continental said it is investigating company data theft following a cyberattack after hackers reportedly put the information for sale. According to a report, the data, which included budget, investment, strategy and customer information, was put up for sale on the darknet after Continental refused to pay ransom. The data is on sale for $50 million.

330.title: Bhuvi to be next captain? Aakash on SRH releasing Williamson ahead of IPL 2023
330.article_body: After SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) released their captain Kane Williamson ahead of IPL 2023, Aakash Chopra took to Twitter and wrote, "Bhuvneshwar Kumar to be the next SRH captain?" Williamson scored 216 runs in 13 matches in IPL 2022. Under the captaincy of Williamson, the 2016 champions finished eighth out of 10 teams on the points table last season.

331.title: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried looking to raise funds: Report
331.article_body: Sam Bankman-Fried, founder of collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX, is reportedly looking to raise fresh cash from investors. The company recently filed for bankruptcy after rival exchange Binance backed out from a deal to buy FTX stating that "the issues are beyond our control or ability to help". Bankman-Fried's entire $16 billion fortune has been wiped out.

332.title: I was called pansy, that wasn't my f***ing identity: Karan Johar
332.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, who recently appeared as a guest on Tweak India, recalled being called "Pansy from Green Lawns High School" or "pansy from HR College". "That wasn't my f***ing identity...and that's what it had become. When I entered college from school I realised I had to wear 'manly clothes'," he added.

333.title: ICC names 10 best individual performances in T20 World Cup 2022
333.article_body: The ICC has named 10 best individual performances in T20 World Cup 2022. It includes Virat Kohli's 82*(53) against Pakistan. The list also features England fast bowler Sam Curran's 3/12 in the final against Pakistan. South Africa pacer Lungi Ngidi's 4/29 against India and Pakistan's Shadab Khan's all-round performance against South Africa also feature on the list.

334.title: Apple Watch helps rescue boy who broke ankles during trek in Maha, Tim Cook reacts
334.article_body: A 17-year-old Maharashtra boy said his Apple Watch saved his life after he fell and broke both his ankles during a trek. Smit Metha said he was rescued as he called for help even without his phone, using his Apple Watch, after getting injured. Apple CEO Tim Cook emailed Smit, "Sounds like a terrible accident...wish you a full...speedy recovery."

335.title: Houses of 4 suspected ISIS sympathisers searched by police in TN
335.article_body: Tamil Nadu Police conducted searches for three hours at the houses of four people, who were allegedly suspected to be Islamic State (ISIS) sympathisers, in Chennai on Tuesday morning. Police seized cash worth ₹15 lakh and 150 mobile phones and other digital gadgets during the searches. Last week, the National Investigation Agency (NIA) raided 40 locations in the state.

336.title: Punjab govt to name schools after martyrs, freedom fighters
336.article_body: The Punjab government has announced that it will name state government schools after martyrs and freedom fighters. Village panchayats and school management committees have been asked to send resolutions for renaming schools to the state headquarters within the next month, state minister Harjot Singh Bains said. They also have to send biographical notes about martyrs and freedom fighters, he added.

337.title: Gagandeep Kang to join Gates foundation as director of global health: Reports
337.article_body: Virologist Gagandeep Kang will take up the role of director of global health at Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, as per reports. Her focus at the foundation will be on enteric diseases (gastrointestinal) and diarrhoeal infections, reports added. She is a professor at Vellore's Christian Medical College and is also part of National Technical Advisory Group on Immunization (NTAGI).

338.title: Punjab orders strict action against those selling Chinese kite strings
338.article_body: Punjab minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer on Tuesday said the state government has asked all Deputy Commissioners to take exemplary action against those selling Chinese kite strings. Recently, a 13-year-old boy died after a Chinese kite string got entangled around his neck in Rupnagar district. There is a blanket ban on the sale and use of such strings in Punjab.

339.title: US wholesale price inflation rises 0.2% in October, less than expected
339.article_body: US wholesale prices continued to rise in October but at a slower pace than in the prior month, according to official data from the Labor Department. The producer price index (PPI) rose just 0.2% compared to September, which was half the pace economists had expected. On a year-over-year basis, PPI rose 8% compared to an 8.4% increase in September.

340.title: Pressure was off me in 'No Way Home' as it was Tom's trilogy: Garfield
340.article_body: Actor Andrew Garfield said the pressure was off him while filming 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' along with Tom Holland and Tobey Maguire. "It was all on Tom's shoulders. Like, it's his trilogy. And, Tobey and [I] were there to provide support and have as good a time as possible," he added. Tobey and Garfield had a cameo in the film.

341.title: Over 5 lakh people visited Aam Aadmi Clinics in last 4 months: Punjab govt
341.article_body: The Punjab government on Tuesday claimed that over 5 lakh people have visited Aam Aadmi Clinics during the last four months, adding that AAP is fulfilling the promise it made in its election manifesto. The Aam Aadmi Clinics across the state have received an overwhelming response and over 8,000 patients visit these clinics daily, Health Minister Chetan Singh Jouramajra said.

342.title: Twitter is very slow in India, it's a fact: Elon Musk
342.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted, "Twitter is very slow in India, Indonesia & many other countries. This is a fact, not "claim"." He added, "10 to 15 seconds to refresh homeline tweets is common. Sometimes, it doesn't work at all, especially on Android phones." Earlier, Musk publicly fired an employee working on Twitter's Android app.

343.title: Rohit Sharma pays tribute to Kieron Pollard in his 1st post after India's T20 WC exit
343.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma took to Instagram to pen his first post on social media following India's exit from T20 World Cup 2022. In the post, he paid tribute to Kieron Pollard, who announced his retirement from IPL. "Big man...big impact and always played with heart...A true MI legend," he wrote. Pollard will be MI's batting coach in IPL 2023.

344.title: Novak Djokovic granted visa to play in 2023 Australian Open: Reports
344.article_body: Novak Djokovic has been granted a visa to play in Australian Open in January 2023, reports stated. Djokovic was deported to Serbia from Australia ahead of Australian Open 2022 after he declined to be vaccinated against coronavirus. The former world number one was originally handed a ban from entering the country until 2025. The ban has reportedly now been overturned.

345.title: At this rate, no one will be left to run Twitter: Engineer publicly fired by Musk
345.article_body: Eric Frohnhoefer, Twitter's Android app developer who was publicly fired by Elon Musk after an argument, said, "Woke up to the news that more Tweeps were summarily fired last night." He added, "At this rate, no one will be left to run Twitter." Notably, Twitter has already fired 50% of its global workforce and 90% of its India team.

346.title: Want to do all kinds of films, play all kinds of characters: Irrfan's son Babil
346.article_body: Late actor Irrfan Khan's son Babil, when asked how he plans to chart out his journey in the film industry, said he's not even attempting to do that. "Because we've...illusion, we think we're in control of our journey, we aren't...I want to do all kinds of films, play all kinds of characters," said Babil, who'll make his debut with 'Qala'.

347.title: India approves 'vostro' accounts for nine banks to push trade in rupees
347.article_body: Federal trade secretary Sunil Barthwal said India has given nine banks approval to open "vostro" accounts to help facilitate trade with Russia in rupees. Barthwal added that three out of the nine accounts have already been opened. Barthwal said Gazprom had opened an account with UCO Bank, and VTB Bank and SberBank have opened accounts with their India-based branch offices.

348.title: Government raises base import prices of palm oil, gold & silver
348.article_body: The government has raised the base import prices of gold, crude and refined palm oil, Ministry of Finance said on Tuesday.
