The revised price of crude palm oil is $960 per metric tonne while refined palm oil is $988 per metric tonne. New prices for gold and silver are $570 per 10 grams and $702 per kg, respectively.

349.title: Gujarat CM to file nomination for Assembly polls tomorrow
349.article_body: Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel will file his nomination for the upcoming state Assembly elections on Wednesday. Union Home Minister Amit Shah will also be present. Shah on Tuesday said that the ruling BJP will break all previous records in the elections and again form government in the state with a huge majority by winning the highest-ever seats.

350.title: EU announces revised target to reduce greenhouse gas emissions
350.article_body: The European Union (EU) announced a revised target to cut down greenhouse gas emissions at COP27 in Egypt on Tuesday. The existing goal for 2030 was to reduce emissions by 55% compared to 1990 levels. This target has now been revised to 57%. "Don't let anybody tell you...the EU is backtracking," said an EU official.

351.title: Germany opens first floating LNG terminal in North Sea
351.article_body: Germany opened the country's first floating terminal for liquefied natural gas (LNG) at the North Sea port of Wilhelmshaven on Tuesday. The facility, which will house a floating storage and regasification unit ship, is expected to be an alternative to the pipeline fuel supplied by Russia. Russia has stopped supplying gas to Germany amidst the war with Ukraine.

352.title: RBI imposes fine on 9 cooperative banks for violating norms
352.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has imposed monetary penalties on nine cooperative banks over deficiencies in regulatory compliance. The bank regulator has fined two banks each from Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh and Odisha and one each from Maharashtra, Jharkhand and Chhattisgarh. The penalties imposed on these lenders range from ₹25,000 to ₹3,10,000.

353.title: Was a blessing that Kashyap gave me an iconic role in 'Gangs...': Aditya
353.article_body: Actor Aditya Kumar, who played the role of Perpendicular in his debut film 'Gangs of Wasseypur 2', said, "I take it as a blessing...privilege that Anurag Kashyap sir gave me that iconic role." He added that his debut film set the bar too high. "I am yet to get a role that can match its standard," Aditya further stated.

354.title: Public servants mustn't make disparaging remarks on countrymen: SC
354.article_body: The Supreme Court said public servants should not make remarks that are "disparaging" or "insulting" to countrymen. The court added that it is an "unwritten rule" and is part of the "constitutional culture" and therefore, there was no need for a code of conduct. "This must be inculcated in our political society and our civic life," Justice BV Nagarathna observed.

355.title: Won't interfere until there's collapse of constitutional machinery: Kerala Guv
355.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Tuesday said he won't interfere in the business of the state government unless there's a total collapse of the constitutional machinery. He went on to say, "Fortunately, that situation does not prevail in Kerala." State government should also respect their limits and it's not their job to run universities, Khan added.

356.title: Fodder inflation at 27.31%, highest since 2013: WPI Report
356.article_body: The annual rate of fodder inflation reached 27.31% in October 2022, which is the highest since 2013, according to the All-India Wholesale Price Index (WPI) data. The WPI-based fodder inflation in October last year was 8.85%. The WPI data was released by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry's Office of the Economic Adviser.

357.title: Financial Services Secy Vivek Joshi nominated as director on RBI's central board
357.article_body: The Centre on Tuesday nominated Secretary of the Department of Financial Services Vivek Joshi as a director on the central board of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI). "The nomination of Shri Vivek Joshi is effective from November 15, 2022 and until further orders," RBI said in a release. The board has 15 seats, of which five are official directors.

358.title: Married Jaya Bachchan because of her long hair: Amitabh Bachchan
358.article_body: A promo for the upcoming episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14' showed Amitabh Bachchan praising a contestant's long hair. He also revealed that he married Jaya Bachchan because she had very long hair. Amitabh and Jaya first met during the shoot of Hrishikesh Mukherjee's 1971 film 'Guddi'. They tied the knot in 1973.

359.title: Zambia seeks answers from Russia on death of citizen in Ukraine war
359.article_body: Zambia has sought explanations from Russia on how one of its citizens who had been serving a prison sentence in Moscow ended up on the battlefield in Ukraine, where he was killed, Zambia's Foreign Minister said on Monday. The minister said that Russia had notified Zambia about Lemekhani Nyirenda's death in September but did not provide any details.

360.title: Top seed Nadal loses 2nd straight Green Group match at ATP Finals
360.article_body: Top seed Rafael Nadal lost his second straight match in the Green Group at ATP Finals in Turin on Tuesday. Fifth seed Felix Auger-Aliassime beat Nadal 6-3, 6-4 to register his maiden win at the season finale. This is the 22-year-old Canadian's first-ever win over Nadal. The Spaniard will now face Norwegian Casper Ruud in his final round-robin match.

361.title: Djokovic beats 2nd seed Tsitsipas for 9th straight time at ATP Finals
361.article_body: Novak Djokovic defeated second-seeded Stefanos Tsitsipas 6-4, 7-6(7-4) for his ninth straight win against the Greek in the players' opening match of Red Group at ATP Finals on Monday. The 21-time Grand Slam champion has beaten Tsitsipas in his third straight tournament following wins in Astana and at Paris Masters. Djokovic won the match in one hour and 37 minutes.

362.title: Hardik is obviously a superstar of the game: Kane ahead of India-NZ T20Is
362.article_body: Praising Hardik Pandya ahead of India-New Zealand T20I series, New Zealand captain Kane Williamson said the India all-rounder is "obviously a superstar of the game". "I have played a lot against him. He is one of the most sought-after match-winners, given the fact that he is an all-rounder," he added. Hardik will lead India in the three-match series.

363.title: Focus on rectifying legal system: Cong to Rijiju over Nehru remarks
363.article_body: After Union Minister Kiren Rijiju said that Jawaharlal Nehru didn't act in the country's interests over Kashmir, Congress asked him to focus on rectifying "a legal system that frees those convicted of murder and gang rape". "He should be more anguished by these than defaming Nehru!" Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said on Twitter. Ramesh called Rijiju's article on Nehru "fraudulent".

364.title: Centre destroying Kerala's higher education sector: Sitaram Yechury
364.article_body: Communist Party of India (Marxist) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury said that the central government was misusing the Governor's office to destroy the higher education sector in Kerala. Yechury inaugurated a mega protest to the Raj Bhavan by the ruling Left Democratic Front (LDF). "In all matters of education, the BJP-led Union government is bypassing the states," he said.

365.title: Minor tied to tree, beaten up over suspicion of theft in Rajasthan
365.article_body: A minor boy was tied to a tree and beaten up on suspicion of being a thief in Rajasthan's Sikar. A video of the incident, which occurred about four months ago, also surfaced online. The victim's mother alleged police inaction and said the Class 4 student had gone to a plot owned by the accused and picked up cards.

366.title: I have never been in a solid relationship in all my 50 years: Karan
366.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar in a recent interview said that he has never been in a "solid relationship" in his life. "There have been fleeting instances that I felt could have been a relationship, but it never fructified. I'm the first one to run out," the 50-year-old director said, adding, "I also feel like I'm really messed up in that department."

367.title: Industrialist met Jay Shah, is trying to lure Cong MLAs into BJP: Cong
367.article_body: Congress MP Digvijaya Singh has alleged that an Indore-based industrialist is involved in the process of luring Congress MLAs to join the BJP. He added, "I've information that...[the] industrialist...met Jay Shah (Home Minister Amit Shah's son)...[and] told him that he can manage some MLAs for the BJP." This comes amid speculations that some Congress legislators are planning to switch sides.

368.title: Youth invited for dinner in Bihar, beaten to death
368.article_body: A youth was beaten to death in Bihar's East Champaran district over a case of personal enmity, police said on Tuesday. The accused, Mukesh Yadav, and his family members assaulted Chandip Yadav at their home after inviting him for dinner. Chandip's mother raised an alarm when he failed to return home. Thereafter, villagers found him lying unconscious at Mukesh's home.

369.title: Over 50 policemen deployed at Tiruchi camp for Rajiv Gandhi assassination convicts
369.article_body: Over 50 police personnel have been reportedly brought in from central and south zones for extra security at the special camp in Tiruchi, where four of the convicts of Rajiv Gandhi assassination case have been lodged. The convicts, Murugan, Robert Payas, Jayakumar and Santhan, were brought to the camp on Saturday from Puzhal and Vellore prisons following Supreme Court orders.

370.title: Jailed Egyptian-British activist has ended hunger strike, family says
370.article_body: Alaa Abdel-Fattah has ended his hunger strike, his family informed on Tuesday citing a letter they said was written by the jailed Egyptian-British political activist himself. The family said they received the letter through Egyptian prison authorities. Amnesty International had earlier warned that Abdel-Fattah could die, due to his hunger strike, amid the COP27 summit currently underway in Egypt.

371.title: Failure of 'Saawariya' and 'Guzaarish' broke my heart: Bhansali
371.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said the failure of 'Saawariya' and 'Guzaarish' broke his heart. He added he returned to his 'Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam' and 'Devdas' style of filmmaking with 'Goliyon Ki Raasleela Ram-Leela' after 'Saawariya' and 'Guzaarish' failed. "Both the films are as precious to me as 'Ram-Leela'...somehow our efforts didn't connect with the audience," he added.

372.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra forced RSS chief to visit mosque: Digvijaya Singh
372.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh said the Bharat Jodo Yatra has "compelled" RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat to visit a madrasa and a mosque. "PM Modi will also start wearing a topi (cap) in a few days," said Singh. He also claimed that PM Modi wears a "topi" in Saudi Arabia and other countries but avoids doing so in India.

373.title: Video shows Jacqueline getting mobbed, social media user says 'This is wrong'
373.article_body: Videos that have surfaced on social media show Jacqueline Fernandez leaving court premises on Tuesday afternoon after her bail hearing. She can be seen getting mobbed by camerapersons, journalists, and bystanders. Reacting to this, a person wrote, "This is wrong. I don't think this is the way to hound someone," while another comment read, "This has such Rhea Chakraborty vibes."

374.title: MS Dhoni likely to help Team India prepare for T20 World Cup 2024: Report
374.article_body: Former Team India captain MS Dhoni is likely to work with Team India's T20I set-up to prepare for T20 World Cup 2024, as per reports. The BCCI is planning to hold talks with MS Dhoni to offer him a role in some capacity, reports added. Notably, Dhoni was mentor of Team India's T20 World Cup 2021 squad.

375.title: Army installs 3D-printed bunkers that can withstand tank fire in eastern Ladakh
375.article_body: The Indian Army has set up 3D-printed permanent defences (bunkers) at the Line of Actual Control in eastern Ladakh. The bunkers can withstand blasts and tank fire, can be erected within 36-48 hours and can be moved from one place to another, Indian Army's Engineer-in-chief Lieutenant General Harpal Singh said. They have been trial tested against a range of weapons.

376.title: Karan reveals he started wearing oversized clothes after being body-shamed
376.article_body: Karan Johar revealed that he hasn't accepted his body, even though it's been years since he was first teased for his weight. "That's why I have a big problem with fitted clothes," he said. "Now...I wear these oversized clothes, but I actually can't bear any tight thing...I don't believe I have a waistline or physique for it," he added.

377.title: He revolutionised Telugu cinema: Rajamouli on actor Krishna's demise
377.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli, mourning the demise of veteran Tollywood actor Krishna, wrote on Twitter, "He revolutionised Telugu cinema with first 70mm film, first colour film and many more." "He taught us not to be afraid of taking the untreaded path," he added. Krishna, father of Mahesh Babu, passed away after suffering a cardiac arrest.

378.title: Morbi bridge collapse highlights cronyism in Gujarat: Congress
378.article_body: The Morbi bridge collapse, which killed 135 people, highlighted the 'cronyism being perpetuated by the BJP government' in Gujarat, the Congress alleged on Tuesday. "The model is that you benefit a few industrialists and leave behind the rest and that leads to a lot of social and economic disparities," said Congress spokesperson Anshul Avijit.

379.title: Delhi BJP releases song sung by MP Manoj Tiwari for MCD polls
379.article_body: The BJP's Delhi unit released its campaign song titled 'BJP ka matlab sewa hai' (BJP means service) for the upcoming MCD polls. Sung by MP Manoj Tiwari, the song narrates the "reality of Delhi", said Delhi BJP President Adesh Gupta. It also reportedly accuses the AAP of turning the Yamuna into a "drain" and converting Delhi into a "gas chamber".

380.title: India's biggest iPhone manufacturing unit to come up near Hosur, to employ 60,000
380.article_body: The biggest unit to manufacture Apple's iPhone in India is coming up near Hosur, an industrial city in Tamil Nadu which is also close to Bengaluru, IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said. It will employ around 60,000 people. Speaking at the Janjatiya Gaurav Divas ceremony, Vaishnaw said 6,000 tribal women residing near Ranchi and Hazaribagh have been trained for making iPhones.

381.title: How much money can each IPL team spend in IPL 2023 auction?
381.article_body: A total of 163 players were retained by IPL franchises, while 85 players were released from existing squads. SRH will have the maximum amount to spend at ₹42.25 crore in the IPL 2023 auction. PBKS follow SRH with ₹32.2 crore. Meanwhile, defending champions GT can spend ₹19.25 crore, while KKR can spend ₹7.05 crore, the least amount among the franchises.

382.title: AAP launches theme song sung by its MLA for Delhi civic polls
382.article_body: The AAP has launched its theme song for the upcoming civic polls in Delhi titled 'MCD mein bhi Kejriwal' (Kejriwal in MCD as well). The 'Kejriwal in MCD' slogan is resonating everywhere and this is reflected in the song, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said. The song has been sung by AAP's Timarpur MLA Dilip Pandey.

383.title: Supreme Court threatens to suspend striking lawyers in Odisha
383.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) has threatened to suspend members of 20 district bar associations in Odisha if they don't call off their strike. "Public cannot be treated like this. This is ridiculous. At the end of the day, they are sufferers because of you," the apex court said while hearing an application filed by the Orrisa High Court.

384.title: BJP govt's welfare measures benefitting tribal community: CM Yogi
384.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday said the BJP government has undertaken several welfare measures that are benefitting the tribal community. Addressing a gathering on 'Tribal Pride Day' in Sonbhadra, he said this is the only district in the country where so many tribal castes live together. Birsa Munda had a special place in India's freedom movement, he added.

385.title: Guptill is one of NZ's best white-ball cricketers ever: Williamson
385.article_body: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson said his teammate Martin Guptill, who was dropped from the squad for upcoming T20I and ODI series against India, is one of New Zealand's best white-ball cricketers ever. He added that the 36-year-old opener brings a lot of good qualities to the team. Guptill is the leading run-scorer for New Zealand in T20Is.

386.title: India and US begin annual joint military drills in Uttarakhand
386.article_body: India and the US began their annual military exercise 'Yudh Abhyas' at a military facility in Uttarakhand on Tuesday. The US Army's soldiers from the Second Brigade of its 11th Airborne Division and Indian Army soldiers from the Assam Regiment are participating in the exercise. This year's edition will end in early December.

387.title: You are Sima Taparia of the industry: Twinkle Khanna to Karan Johar
387.article_body: Author Twinkle Khanna, during a conversation with Karan Johar, has said that the filmmaker is the Sima Taparia of the film industry because of his matchmaking skills. "You keep doing this matchmaking...your father did the same thing. When I was speaking to Waheeda Rehman, she mentioned...your father fixed up her marriage," she added.

388.title: Those who see Bharat as their motherland are Hindus: RSS chief
388.article_body: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) chief Mohan Bhagwat on Tuesday said, "We have been telling since 1925...a person who believes Bharat is his mother and motherland is Hindu." "We had common ancestors. Every Indian who is part of the 40,000-year-old 'Akhand Bharat' has common DNA," he added. "Our ancestors had taught that everyone should stick to their faith," Bhagwat said.

389.title: Happy to play for new franchise: Shardul after being traded from DC to KKR
389.article_body: After being traded from Delhi Capitals (DC) to Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) ahead of IPL 2023, bowling all-rounder Shardul Thakur, in a video posted by KKR's official Twitter handle, said he's happy to play for the new franchise. "I'll always give my best...Very excited to meet new people...will play cricket the hard way. So Kolkata, here I come," he added.

390.title: Ex-Man Utd teammates Rooney and Neville are not my friends: Ronaldo
390.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo, during his interview with journalist Piers Morgan, claimed that former teammates Wayne Rooney and Gary Neville are not his friends. "They are not my friends, they are colleagues," said Ronaldo. He added that it was "hard" to hear Rooney and Neville's criticism and wondered if they had to criticise him to "be more famous".

391.title: 7th-tier English club makes 28-day loan offer for Man City's Haaland
391.article_body: English football's seventh-tier club Ashton United has made a 28-day loan offer for Manchester City forward Erling Haaland. As Haaland is not participating in the World Cup, Ashton said they could offer him match practice in the break before City's next game. "We think he...would slot in with our squad dynamic really well," said Ashton manager Michael Clegg.

392.title: US woman, boyfriend charged with killing sister, 3-week-old niece
392.article_body: A woman, along with her boyfriend, in the US state of California on Monday was charged with the murder of her sister and 3-week-old niece, prosecutors informed. The killings were motivated by jealousy and sibling rivalry, prosecutors said. Yarelly Solorio-Rivera and her boyfriend Martin Arroyo-Morales were each charged with two counts of murder and a special circumstance of multiple murders.

393.title: Really good boy: Man City manager Guardiola on rape-accused Mendy
393.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola reportedly termed rape-accused player Benjamin Mendy a "really good boy". The Spanish coach reportedly added that he is not Mendy's "father" and does not know what the player does in his private life. Mendy faces seven charges of rape, one charge of attempted rape and one charge of sexual assault against six young women.

394.title: Amit Shah's firmness made power transition smooth in Maha: Fadnavis
394.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said Union Home Minister Amit Shah's firmness helped in the smooth transition of power in the state. "Amit Shah offered his staunch support...Once he decides about a thing, he gets it done," said. He added that the BJP "countered the Shiv Sena's betrayal" and allied with the "original Shiv Sena" and form the government.

395.title: Delhi HC rejects Uddhav's plea against EC freezing Shiv Sena symbol
395.article_body: The Delhi High Court has dismissed former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's plea against the Election Commission's (EC) order to freeze Shiv Sena's bow and arrow symbol. The court also asked the EC to expedite the decision on the matter. In October, the EC directed both Eknath Shinde and Thackeray's factions to not use the name 'Shiv Sena' or the symbol.

396.title: School bus crashes off embankment in Kentucky; 18 children hurt
396.article_body: A school bus crashed off an embankment and landed on its side in the US state of Kentucky on Monday, leaving the driver and 18 children on board injured, authorities said. The crash occurred on a state highway near Salyersville in eastern Kentucky, the affected school district informed. The bus was reportedly carrying students from elementary school through high school.

397.title: Brazil, France and England favourites to win 2022 FIFA WC: Messi
397.article_body: Argentina forward Lionel Messi has picked Brazil, France and England as favourites to win the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar. "Whenever we talk about candidates, we always talk about the same teams...But the World Cup is...so complicated that anything can happen," said Messi. Argentina's opening Group C match is against Saudi Arabia, after which they face Mexico and Poland.

398.title: Bihar govt extends deadline for caste-based census till May
398.article_body: The Bihar Cabinet on Tuesday granted a three-month extension to general administrative department to submit a detailed report about the caste-based census. The department was asked to complete the caste-based census by February next year. This decision was taken due to hectic engagement of officials in the examinations and revision of electoral rolls.

399.title: Telangana Congress leader Pawar Patel resigns, likely to join BJP
399.article_body: Pawar Ramarao Patel, the President of Nirmal District Congress Committee in Telangana, resigned from his position and primary membership of the party on Monday. He resigned after holding a meeting with his supporters in Bhainsa town. As per reports, Patel will join the BJP on November 28. Ex-MLA Alleti Maheshwar Reddy said Patel was a senior Congress member in Nirmal.

400.title: 1,001 examples of Kerala govt interfering with universities: Guv
400.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammad Khan said he could give 1,001 examples of the state government interfering with the daily functioning of universities. Khan added that he would resign if anyone could cite one example where he tried to interfere in the state government's business. "Universities have become fiefdoms of the party cadre and their relatives," said Khan.
